Reviews.Title: “5 Months there (I had already paid), worst Hotel ever.”
Reviews.Author: Beatrice P
Reviews.Content: Sorry for mistakes, I'm not American, but I know what I'm talking about because I lived 5 moths here. This expensive Hotel promotes wi-fi, but is that slow that it's like don't have it, most of the time it doesn't even work. I had problems even with the heating that wasn't working. When after some days they fixed the heating, they didn't want to turn it on because outside was 50 degrees (to me it's cold and there was a terrible wind that was entering from the windows that don't close very well). If you ask for clean towels they tell you that in the contract they are supposed to give them to you no more than once per week. If you have problems with something they don't help you. The lights of my room, used to work some day yes some day not. I saw 3 times cockroaches and they didn't want to send somebody to do something, but the just gave me a spray. The elevator is terribly slow and once stuck at the second floor for about 3 minutes (I was so scared!), but luckily it started again. Useless say that when I told them, they didn't even pay attention. Last thing, but not less important, after the first month sleeping there, me and my husband started having strong back pain (the mattress is horrible!). The ONLY positive thing is that is pretty close to the subway and that is not really dirty. So if you are planning to stay here, I strongly suggest you to change plans!

Reviews.Title: “Great for moving to New York and looking for a more permanent place”
Reviews.Author: Megan L
Reviews.Content: Moved to New York and had problems finding an apartment and then had to wait for my apartment to become available. I stayed here for a month and a half, only complaint is that the rooms were a little small, but what isn’t in New York. Great value, staff were friendly, but not overbearing. Had an issue with my air conditioner and it was replaced within a couple hours. Area is great too: close to the 2-3 express train and Central Park. Lots of grocery shopping close by too. Would definitely recommend for anyone who needs a short term place to stay when moving to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Little Place In The Upper West Side.”
Reviews.Author: JohnnyRoug
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend travelled to New York in December 2010. When we first arrived check in was quick and easy and only took a few minutes. we were given a room on the 6th floor which was basic but was perfect for us as we weren't planning on spending much time in it anyway! We were apprehensive about sharing a bathroom with other people as this was the first time we have ever done this. But to be honest it was no problem at all as the bathroom was always free and was right next to our room. So i wouldn't advise paying the extra for your own bathroom. The lift in the hotel was quite slow but thats just a minor rather picky observation. The hotel staff were also very friendly and helpful, we asked for advice a couple times about where to get off the subway and stuff, and they always went out of their way to explain everything to us. Also their was always someone on the reception 24 hours a day. Also they were quick to respond when we asked for clean towels, they were brought up really quickly. There was also internet available in the lounge area,you paid 1 Dollar and got 10 minutes which i thought was reasonable. The hotel was also in an ideal location for jumping on and off the subway as it was a two minute walk to the station. So overall i would definitely recommend this hotel to people looking to visit New York on a budget!

Reviews.Title: “Very Satisfied”
Reviews.Author: john f
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the hotel for three months while my Manhattan apartment was being renovated. Let me put things in important perspective: the hotel cost less than half the price per night than at the Lincoln Center area YMCA. Let me repeat: half the price of a YMCA. I saw a photo of a room on the hotel's website which i thought way too nice to be a real photo. When i visited the hotel and looked at rooms i found rooms exactly like the photo. The one i occupied was luvly, newly renovated with a great king bed HD tv, small refrigerator and microwave, not huge but completely adequate, clean, comfortable and quiet. The hotel is situated on a quiet upper west side brownstone street, a two minute walk to the express Broadway subway line at 94th Street and one minute walk to Riverside Park. Great location. The management and support people starting with Evan, the manager, were all courteous, helpful and nice. I did not have one unpleasant exchange during three months of occupancy. Once a week the room was thoroughly cleaned and linens and towels replaced. There are shortcomings: there is one small elevator. It works but it certainly at times requires patience. The hotel wifi is very slow and i purchased mobile connectivity during my stay. And the lobby and hallways are not up to those of a high price hotel. But all in all i think it is an amazing value for the money. There is absolutely nothing on the upper west side of Manhattan as nice for the money by a country mile. It fit the bill perfectly for my needs and I heartily recommend it for anyone on a budget on a longer term stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good value compromise”
Reviews.Author: SGeerdron
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel to try to stay as central as possible while not paying through the nose or staying in an absolute hole. And it served its purpose pretty well. Shared bathroom was clean, good powerful shower. Ac in room a bit noisy at night but that was the main complaint, and the key point was it was a 5 min walk to the subway from which you could get downtown in 10-20 minutes on the fast train. Also very pleasant to be able to wander to Central Park. Overall would consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “I booked a room for 2 months. departed 3days early but hotel doesn't return me the money for those 3 days early depar”
Reviews.Author: leekqu
Reviews.Content: 1) The room does not agree with I booked. 2) Do not trust this Hotel's website said "no charges for early departures". I booked room for about two months. I departed 3 days early but hotel have not given me back the money for those 3 day early departures. I am going to go to my creditcard company to claim it.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Watamis S
Reviews.Content: I am currently staying at Hotel Alexander and I'm booked into a double queen bed room. I am pretty happy with the hotel's location, service level and room quality. The location's splendid: the 96th street subway access is just 2 mins' walk away, and you can take the express 2 & 3 trains to Times Square in 15 mins. There are plenty of amenities within 2-5 mins' walk - pharmacies, convenience stores, supermarkets, cafes (including Starbucks), laudromarts, and restaurants. The room I have is of decent quality. I love the modern furniture they use and the bathroom is as per the pictures you see on their website - very clean and modern. The bed's comfort is decent and the study desk and table are of good quality. There's LCD TV and wireless access in the room too. The only complaint I have though, is that there is no heater in the room. I've asked the front desk twice and apparently there have been plenty of complaints. Although New York is looking warmer this week, my room was cold as it faces the back (which is quieter than those street facing ones). So I had to get a portable heater from Bed, Bath & Beyond for $60, after having sleepless nights from the cold. Other than the aircon issue the service quality is pretty good. Brittany reserved the room for me couple of weeks prior to my arrival and was responsive to my emails when I was overseas. I was checked in efficiently and the front desk is helpful. My parcels were duly received and I was informed too. I would highly recommend Hotel Alexander to my anyone as long as they are not too particular about the upkeep of the common areas, but appreciates the room's quality and the hotel's accessibility.

Reviews.Title: “great value for money and fit for purpose”
Reviews.Author: Kat6919
Reviews.Content: this hotel was perfect for what we needed it for, basically a place to sleep after long days sightseeing and meals out. My boyfriend and I visited New York for my birthday during December and we wanted somewhere cheap but in a nice area and that is what we got. the Upper West Side is a lovely place to stay, it was so easy to get into Times Square via the subway and I felt completely safe. The hotel itself was pretty basic, however it was clean and great value for money. there was no need for us to spend double the price on a lodger hotel that we were going to spend so little time in. There have been negative comments on this website regarding the reception staff however I found them to be very helpful, calling us taxi's straight away and recommending places to eat, particularly a little diner round the corner for a typical American breakfast!! My only complaint would be that the pipes in the room did wake us up at times but It didn't put us off and I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. I recommend anyone to stay here, particularly young people, just don't expect luxury for the price you are paying.

Reviews.Title: “I recommend...”
Reviews.Author: Garotis
Reviews.Content: We stayed again in the Alexander Hotel. After two years, I had the same opinion. The location is very good. There are many restaurants coffees and grocery stores near the hotel. Besides, the metro station is very near and convenient. We agree that the room is small, but it is clean and comfortable. Besides, the price is very reasonable. I recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: VLF1601
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for one night with some friends of mine. I really like the hotel's location and the price was quite reasonnable. The room was good size and beds comfortable. Will probably go there again on my next trip to NY

Reviews.Title: “Terrible! Condemned notice, fire in room, loud A/C, dirty shared bath!”
Reviews.Author: DFMILES
Reviews.Content: Our stay was terrible! Looking for a bargain I booked this room, thinking it would be ok. The elevator was so slow it barely moved, the room was tiny and bed hard, the air conditioner sounded like a plane engine, the shared bath tub had dirty feet marks and to top it all off -- there was a FIRE in a room near ours because someone decided to cook bacon. The door on the outside also had a notice that said the building was being condemned by the city of NY. Do not stay here!

Reviews.Title: “No thrills”
Reviews.Author: Raluca L
Reviews.Content: If you are not too picky and you are looking just for a place where to rest during the night, Hotel Alexander is a good choice. The room and bathroom are clean (I had a room with a private bathroom). The location is not so great but is close enaugh to the metro station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to Stay in New York. Worth Money Spent.”
Reviews.Author: Coraat2011
Reviews.Content: Good Friendly Service, just have to find the right one at Reception Desk. My rooms were nice, ensuite bathroom, big space for a solo traveller. Clean Place, Internet free Wi-Fi at Reception Breakfast Room. Bid LCD screen in room. From the place you can easily reached , Central Park, Lincon Center... Subway a few walking blocks. I used to walk in the morning and I almost reached every central spot in Manhattan, than came back by Tub You can shop for food nearby. I wish they do have a microwave and water electric pot in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Most uncomfortable beds ever to grace a hotel room.”
Reviews.Author: hana15
Reviews.Content: Ok so this was my experience of staying at the hotel. The location is lovely, really nice area of the city. Quiet and off the main road with all the sirens and traffic etc. 2 mins walk to the Subway and lots of place sto get breakfast near by. Booked into a double room , reception staff were professional but far from super friendly. On arriving in our room we were more than happy, the decor was modern and looked newly renovated. Everything was tidy and spotlessly clean. Desk, TV, etc.Good size room especially for NYC and compact little bathroom. All was going so well until we lay on the bed. IT FELT LIKE IT WAS MADE OF CONCRETE/STONE , i have never felt a bed so hard and uncomfortable in all my life. To add insult to injury there was one poxy pillow each, which must have come from the bargain store as it was 1/2'' thick , with barely any filling! We asked for extra pillows which we got the next day. Very difficult to sleep and get comfortable which is far from desirable when you have along haul flight to look forward too the next day. I don't want to run the place down as i've stayed in worse, but if its comfort and a good nights sleep i'd stay away from here. I wouldn't want to stay here again and risk spoiling my time in NYC being grumpy and tired!

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTING!”
Reviews.Author: tumbledry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel for 15 days in December 2010. I booked the hotel directly and for the price did not expect luxury BUT I was told by phone when I called to ask, that free wifi was included. It was but it did not work 90 % of the time. This was a huge let down as I was taking a vacation but needed to use the internet to write reports that I needed to complete usually in the evenings after my days out in the city. As a result I had no choice but to spend most of my time sitting in either McDonalds or Starbucks where I could have wifi access. Each time I called the front desk to report the problem I was usually told that a technician had been called. On approaching the front desk clerk one evening he very honestly told me that they had been having connectivity problems for months....I explained my situation to him and he indicated that I could obtain a reduction in my rate when I checked out. When I asked for this on check out the front desk clerk ( a young lady) told me that I needed to contact the manager after the fact by email or phone. I did this by email on a number of occasions the following weeks but NEVER repeat NEVER received a response! I was paying an average daily rate of $102.00 plus tax. To conclude I'd like to say that it is the principal of the situation and the fact that one does not get what one pays for. In fact on check out the young lady indicated that most hotels do not provide free wifi. I told her that maybe so but that most hotels do not promote the fact they they do such as the case at Hotel Alexander.

Reviews.Title: “Are you kidding me????”
Reviews.Author: francescake
Reviews.Content: I booked a reservation a week in advance for a room for the long Martin Luther King weekend. I called to confirm the reservation. It was all set. Then I get home last night to an email telling me that my reservation was canceled and that I had been switched to a sister hotel the Hotel 99. When I called the hotel 99 they said I had to pay the rate that I had at the Alexander. The rate at the 99 was less but they would not honor it. There was no explanation for the cancellation and just a message saying they were not taking reservations indefinitely. The 99 only had a room with a shared bath to offer me.Even though for less money at the Alexander I had a private bath. I ended up having to find another hotel and pay more money. I would love to have an explanation as to why my reservation canceled!

Reviews.Title: “Would book @ Hotel Alexander in a minute!”
Reviews.Author: jenepher
Reviews.Content: Great location,2 blocks from subway(Broadway & 96th) Great rate Clean, got a room with a newly renowed bathroom. love that! good size.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad for the Price”
Reviews.Author: OneSeattleGirl
Reviews.Content: Positives: Overall the room was clean and the staff was nice. The location is just a block off of Broadway and easy to get to from the subway. Negatives: The room we were given, 204, was next to the staff break room. The staff was nice, but loud at times. The room we selected was a remodeled queen with private bath, but the room was not remodeled. The bathroom was though and very nice. Worst: The mechanical system is really loud and will wake you up several times in the night. Added Advice: spring for the private bath, the public ones need an upgrade. I would say go for it, but not in our room.ROOM 024 not a good option

Reviews.Title: “A clean room, comfy bed, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Jjejptorres
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nothing fancy, the lobby isn't, the stairway isn't, the room is clean, the bathroom in our room was newly renovated, the room was clean, and the bed was very comfortable! The service was good, the first day we got there we had no towels in our room, we went down to front desk and they got some for us quickly. Check out is at 12:00, but our flight didn't leave until 5:00, so they were able to put our luggage in a room the day we checked out so that we didn't have to carry it around on our last day. The location is 3 blocks from the subway, and is in a nice location on the Upper West Side, there are some great diners, and bakery's close by! We had a great time on our visit!

Reviews.Title: “clean rooms, handy location - definately recommend for a cheap hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Joanna1616
Reviews.Content: hotel alexander was a great find - we stayed for 9 days and the room was cleaned every day with clean towels, had a TV and also common room, would recommend to book a room with shared bath as we did, definately made a difference as most other rooms have shared bathrooms - gives you a bit more privacy. Its a bit out of times square but it is right beside a subway on 96th street and only takes 3 mins to travel in. But the walk is great too - plently of great shops and brilliant restaurants we would have missed had we been in the centre!! Definately walk around outside of 42nd street!! Hotel alexander was great value for money and couldnt want more

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: MarceloSales
Reviews.Content: This hotel has good value. Despite the bulding age (old), is well mantained. My room was spacious and has good private bathroom. There was a large Lcd in the room with some HD channels for relax after a whole day of walking. Cleanliness was excellent (daily) and towels were changed with frequency. Lorah and Kandia were polite and there were no problems during my stay. The location is 2 blocks away from the train (subway) in a excellent area with surrounding cafes, banks, market, etc. I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, and great A/C!”
Reviews.Author: DLillith21
Reviews.Content: The hotel was a great deal for a budget traveler looking to spend most of their time out and about, but wanting a comfortable space to return to at the end of the day. It was very hot in NYC when we were there, and the AC at the hotel was fabulous, and so nice to cool off at night. Easy walking distance to subway, and lots of great breakfast places nearby. Walking distance to Central Park. Newly remodeled bathrooms, small, but clean and well kept.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, good location, clean rooms for a reasonable price”
Reviews.Author: askmanny
Reviews.Content: i stayed two nights at The Alexander while in NYC this Fall. The price was reasonable (just under $200 per night) for what you can find elsewhere in Manhattan. The room was very clean and the bathroom was immaculate. the location is within walking distance of several subway lines and Broadway where a million cabs will take you anywhere you need. Also, the area (Upper West Side, by Riverside) is pretty safe and the street it's on is not too busy. On the downside, the first night I saw my sleep interrupted by folks a couple of rooms away who were noisy and smoking a lot. I told the receptionist about it the next morning and they said you should report those cases to them b/c it is a no-smoking hotel. As for Wi-Fi, I could never figure out the code I needed to enter to make it work, but maybe it was me or that the Wi-Fi is only available in the lobby (many hotels do this). I got a private bathroom, so I can't speak for the shared bathroom option they offer, but overall, the experience was very positive and this is a highly recommendable option for affordable stays in the City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, super clean, only bad thing shared bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: KandyKane056
Reviews.Content: My sister and I stayed at Hotel Alexander to visit Columbia University. The room was bigger than we expected, although it was a double bed. We had 2 closets in the room, a desk and a chair and a TV. We had problems the first day getting the space heater on but I asked in the reception and the room was nice and warm after that. The room was clean and the bathroom too. I saw the cleaning lady cleaning the bathroom several times a day and when I used it it was clean. BYO soap, you have hand soap in the room but not in the bathroom. The location in Upper West Side was excellent, residential area very quiet and close to the subway station. The staff was attentive and called a cab for us when we were going to NJ. Even thoguh it was more expensive than a hostel, it was worth it. Clean rooms, clean bathrooms and a safe area. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine, nothing special”
Reviews.Author: cartist
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a 5th floor room when the elevator was often out of commission or busy. Rooms were adequate. The location at 96th and West End meant a block walk to the subway. I booked because I thought it was more inexpensive than others according to Trip Advisor; however, my room with "private bath" average more than $250 a night - not cheap, really. I would look for other places in the future if more cost-effective.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Clean Clean and a free tote!”
Reviews.Author: calvin1984
Reviews.Content: I was in NYC for a couple days for a conference and Hotel Alexander's nightly rates fit into my company's budget. When I arrived I was greeted with a free tote! It was a perfect start and great souvenir with the NYC skyline! The location was perfect for my conference and the room was super clean. Definitely coming back! And I use the tote every day!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel, Great Value for Money, Very Clean”
Reviews.Author: Dublinissimo
Reviews.Content: I read some negative reviews about this hotel and was actually considering cancelling my hoiday. Just before going, I discovered I was pregnant so wasn't sure if I should really stay in a "Budget " Hotel, I was worried about cleanliness and hygiene. However, I was pleasantly surprised when we arrived. We had a double room, renovated, en-suite. The bed was nice and firm, just how I like it and the linens were impeccably clean. The room was given a clean every day and unlike a lot of New York , this was a bedbug-free zone. The room was quite spacious, with a wardrobe, writing desk and bedside table. There was both heating and air-conditioning. We used both as it was a week of very changeable weather when we stayed. We also had cable TV and a radio/alarm clock. The hotel offers free Wi-Fi in all rooms, an extremely useful service if you have an iphone or Ipod. If you don't have these, there are two computers in the communal room for internet access. The staff were very pleasant and accommodating. We had a problem with the toilet one morning and it was sorted out within five minutes. The location was good, in a relatively quiet area, but with some nice European-style cafes and even a couple of American diners nearby. The Subway was a 2 minute walk and brings you to the heart of downtown within 10 minutes. Just one thing to note, if you don't book an en-suite, you will have a shared bathroom (I think it was one per corridor). I had thought this would be like in a hostel with a few different stalls but actually it was just enough for one person. Although, I never saw a queue outside. What I liked best about this hotel: Great value for money, very clean What I liked least about this hotel: Having to leave! I would definitely stay here again and would strongly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient location and good value”
Reviews.Author: DC20001
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alexander is conveniently located on the Upper West Side. This is not a fancy hotel but it's perfect for people who are in the city for the weekend and are only sleeping there. The rooms look kind of old but are clean. The staff is nice and helpful. They have a little storage room where you can store your luggage for FREE after checking out on the last day (which is not always the case). I stayed at the hotel when I took the bar exam last July and I loved that it was so close to Central Park where I enjoyed a nice jog after a day of exam. It is also metro accessible. In short, good value!

Reviews.Title: “a great experience”
Reviews.Author: wauker
Reviews.Content: Though the hotel is old, the room we were given on the 5th floor was "brand new". It was spacious and well decorated. The bed and all coverings were like sleeping on a cloud. The staff was very gracious and helpful. The location provided enjoyable walks.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic -too few bathrooms”
Reviews.Author: munro276
Reviews.Content: OK it's in a good location,cheap and the rooms are clean,but two bathrooms per floor is just woefully inadequate particularly when not all of the showers work. Whole place is in need of upgrading, furniture battered, threadbare carpets . Definitely one for the budget concious (young?) backpacker.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, close to subway, frinedly staff - you get what you pay for!”
Reviews.Author: Analia_S
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews on this website over about 6 months we were very worried about our stay at Hotel Alexander. After flying/travelling for over 30 hours from Australia we finally made it to the hotel after 11pm and all my friend and I wanted to do was shower and get into our own beds and sleep! When we checked in we were told that the room we had booked 6 months ago (2 single beds with private bath) was not available and they tried to butter us up saying they were giving us a better room which had a renovated bathroom but only one double bed! The guy at the counter was nice and we were too tired to argue but we agreed that if we didn't like the room then we could swap to the room that we had originally booked. So we had a terrible nights sleep as my friend and I had to share a bed which was very uncomfortable so the next morning we complained and after a few discussion with the reception staff we were moved to the room we originally booked. Apart from that initial hiccup, we found Hotel Alexander to be great for what we wanted. Its 2 blocks from the subway which was great for us as we used the subway everyday. The room was cleaned daily and we were provided with fresh towels and soap. On the downside, the rooms dont have irons or ironing boards, kettles/tea/coffee, fridge, safe, mini bar or anything else you would expect in a hotel. This was annoying for us because we were staying there for 2 weeks and couldnt even buy food and keep it in the fridge or lock away our valuables. My advice would be not to leave anything valuable in the room such as passports ect and lock everything in your suitcase daily. Having said that, they do have a safe behind the reception counter (I wouldnt trust that) and offer free tea/coffe in the lounge area and cheap internet which was $1 for 10 minutes. All in all you do get what you pay for! This is a budget, no frills hotel. It is not the Hilton! You will not get room service or anything fancy. You will get a clean, well maintained room close to the subway. If I visit New York again I would be happy to stay at Hotel Alexander as the staff were friendly, the neighbourhood quiet and the location near the subway.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and comfortable room at an affordable price.”
Reviews.Author: auburnzimo
Reviews.Content: Location on 94th Street on the Upper West Side is convenient, right off the 96th Street Metro stop. Our room was quiet, spacious, and comfortable, with a clean bathroom and great shower water pressure. The staff was friendly and helpful, especially when we asked to borrow a hair dryer. The price was affordable and they were able to accommodate me only a few days in advance.

Reviews.Title: “friendly staff and fabulous location!”
Reviews.Author: scrumpysprout
Reviews.Content: This hotel was great and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location was excellent nice and quiet after a day in NYC.yet close to shops, diners and the subway The shared bathroom was always clean and available. Fresh towels every day and they even helped me order take out! I would certainly use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, inexpensive and well situated”
Reviews.Author: English_Frankie
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel. When searching for a hotel in NY, I looked for one that was fairly central (Manhattan) and reasonably priced (i.e. as cheap as possible) and I found exactly that in Hotel Alexander. So as to keep the cost down, we opted to have a triple room with a shared bathroom in the corridor. I was nervous about it as I don't like sharing bathrooms with other rooms usually but I needn't have worried. There were three bathrooms for the floor and in 5 days I didn't have to wait once - at least one was always available. The hotel is spotlessly clean, even the communal bathrooms. The room was very clean and the lovely cleaner always tidied it up and put things away for us, so we always had a nice clean room to come back to at the end of the day. The location is really good as well. We were within walking distance to Central Park and it is a nice area, lots of wholesome looking people! The price was right as well. We only paid Â£506 for a four person room for 5 nights so for each person, it didn't cost much more than a youth hostel. I would definately recommend this hotel and can't think of one bad thing to say about it.

Reviews.Title: “The Hotel Alexanderin New York â€“ good price but noisy with cockroachs”
Reviews.Author: Andrew155019
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really a cross between a hostel and a hotel but is good value if donâ€™t care about noise from doors slamming in the hall all nights and cockroach. The service at the front desk was poor. We found cockroach every night and morning we stayed there. We asked many times at the front desk to do something about it without success. There were doors in our hallway that slammed shut every time someone came through all night. The local neighbourhood is great with cafes, diners, delis, convenience stores and restaurants. Our room was cheap and clean, so if you're looking not to spend a lot and aren't expecting a lot, this place will be perfect. I know next time I go to the City, I will pay a little more to stay in a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: JudithandRay
Reviews.Content: Me and my boyfriend stayed in this hotel and it was great! The location of the hotel was nearby the subway station, that was very usefull. The room was very clean, cleaning service every day and we recieved new towels every day (no washing gloves though). The service was very good, like there was something wrong with our tv, we asked for help and when we came back from the city the problem was fixed, so that was very quick. The bed was good, but quite hard to lay down on it, though we slept well in it. A thing that could be improved.. there was a card for the cleaning people wich you could turn red and green and put it in your door, but when we got back to our room the card was removed several times.. wich was a bit anoying.

Reviews.Title: “Good Price, close to subway”
Reviews.Author: True_Blondie
Reviews.Content: This hotel was what you would expect of an older NY hotel. Small staircase, really small elevator (holds 4 people uncomfortably) and small rooms. But the beds were nice, my husband & I both slept well. You had the option in this hotel to have a dorm type room with shared bath or a room with a private bathroom attached. We chose the private bath. The only downside is that there is no parking, so you have to park on the street & move it depending on the day or pay $35 a day at the underground parking across the street. Parking is tight and we had our bumper scraped but that's NY.

Reviews.Title: “HIGHLY FAVORED”
Reviews.Author: Kristyluv
Reviews.Content: The hotel very nice for the price The employees was very nice especially a guy name Kader was very nice and very understanding when we called him about certain situations so definately I give this place 2 thumbs up because of the attention we got while staying there for 7 nights Only advice I give for the hotel is it needs a more efficient elevator and we never got small washclothes I thought every hotel supply those but thanks to many reviews we brought our own but other than that its a very nice hotel in a convient part of town so thumbs up once again to Kader he is very attentive and derserve a reward of some kind because he take his job serious and do whatever he can to make you comfortable....Thanks for making our stay comfortable....

Reviews.Title: “Good Value hotel near subway”
Reviews.Author: pmacker
Reviews.Content: Five minute walk to the subway, safe area, clean room and under $100 a night. Try finding anything similar/better in NY at that price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - No frills hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shazza099
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel Alexander for 11 nights and found it very comfortable. I was a bit concerned about sharing a bathroom but found it was nearly always free, if not there is another just around the corner. They were always well maintained and clean. There are no facilities in the rooms other than a TV and hairdryer but if you need anything (iron/ironing board) ask at reception and they will provide it for you. The hotel is very close to the subway and is a pleasant 10 minute walk from the centre of central park. It is also very close to Broadway which has every kind of shop you will need. This is a no frills hotel but is still clean and comfortable and very friendly, just don't expect state of the art decor or you will be dissapointed. I would definitely stay here again and would recommend it to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, relatively inexpensive hotel with great location”
Reviews.Author: drugiviator
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Alexander Hotel for 10 days in April, 2010. For the first five days, I stayed in a double room with a colleague of mine; after another colleague of ours joind us, we switched to a four-bed room. The double room was a tiny one, with a quite loud heating system. Otherwise, everything was ok. The four-bed room was much better, and we really enjoyed it. Btw, there's no internet in the rooms, only in the lobby. The hotel is clean and it has a great location (bust five minutes from the metro station, not far from Colmbia university and Riverside Park).

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive and Convenient”
Reviews.Author: mightmouse
Reviews.Content: I needed an inexpensive hotel in New York to stay for a week. I found Hotel Alexandria and was pleasantly surprised. The hotel is located about 2 minutes from the subway station in a very nice part of New York City. I also found the hotel to be very clean and the hotel staff very pleasant and helpful. It was also very quiet at night. The room was a bit small but since I was traveling alone that really didn't matter. During my 2 week stay I also stayed at a much more expensive hotel on the East side. This hotel was a mile walk from the nearest subway and I felt much less safe in that neighborhood. I would definitely stay at Hotel Alexandria again if I were in New York.

Reviews.Title: “Make a reservation, you will not be disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: AGB2010
Reviews.Content: This year, the hotel I usually make reservartion with had raised it rates significantly. I'm retired and living on a fixed income. I was very upset because I needed to visit my sister (she does not have room in her small apartment for a guest), and could not afford what the hotel was asking. I do not remember how my internet search found the Alexander Hotel, but the hotel was in the exact location that I needed and the previous guest reviews were all very positive, so I entered my booking information. The prices were much more reasonable (the New York City taxes are horrible, but you would have to pay these at any hotel), and they offered a discount based on the number of days. Looking forward to my next visit!!

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been better”
Reviews.Author: Casablanca96
Reviews.Content: We are two oldsters [89 & 88], living together in Upstate NY Found Hotel Alexander to be just what we wanted. A low key hostelry, with none of the extras that we would not need: e.g. a pool, fitness center, entrance lounge, et al. Located a block from Riverside Park with its walking paths and statue of Jeanne d'Arc to the west and Broadway with interesting eateries a block to the east . Our room included a bathroom with shower. Everything looked almost new and in good taste. This was our first to the Hotel Alex, but that is where we stay in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel Alexandar?? Try HOSTEL Alexandar.. this place SUCKS!”
Reviews.Author: popCT
Reviews.Content: If you like hard rock beds.. 10 inch tv's that is attached to the ceiling with 3 channels & no remote,...creepy large closets with nothing in them, not even a rack or hangers..no private bathroom and sharing a bathroom with random strangers...90 degree rooms aka sauna's on the 6th floor with window unit air conditioners that sounds like they are about to blow up..a Claustraphobic elevators that takes two minutes to get to the 6th floor..maids that speak absolutely no english so when you are asking them for something like a towel & they refuse to give it to you and run away like you are the crazy one... getting locked out of your room for no reason when your still staying there...not having your hotel room cleaned...asking to have a private bathroom and then finding out to "upgrade" to a private bathroom in this lovely establishment is an extra $150 dollars...calling the "front desk" or "housekeeping" that is always busy...rude employees.. & last but not least being right next to Harlem and a neighborhood with nothing near it... THEN THIS IS THE PLACE FOR YOU! If you would like a HOTEL Room with a private bathroom that is NOT a Hostel, central air, a tv that you can actually see and that has a remote and more then 3 channels, having your room cleaned, maids that can comprehend that you need a towel to take a shower, a front desk that rings and that is never busy when you need something, a bed that is not like sleeping on pavement, clean sheets, an opportunity to upgrade to a suite vs a room with a bathroom, friendly staff and in a good area .. then this is NOT the place for you.. Stay FAR FAR AWAY!! Spend the extra hundred bucks to get a normal room somewhere else and in a good area. The site may look good, but its a bunch of BULL SH*T!

Reviews.Title: “smart cheap accomodation”
Reviews.Author: giodiste
Reviews.Content: I was ther from 04/29 to 05/05, it's close to subway station, very quiet and safe area, kind customers and, last but not least, cheap.I payed 125/night, queen bed room with private bath.no similar prices in manhattan. maybe cleaning girls are a bit lazy, but I used to leave room at 9 a.m. and get back at 5 and room was clean and in order - they change always soap, altough it's not finished, it's a waste.. - no hairdrier, but they got at reception. sure when I'll be back to nyc I'll stay in alexander

Reviews.Title: “Nice, lovely, quiet, friendly...”
Reviews.Author: UrV
Reviews.Content: I was in New York for a conference and for a short brake/hollidays after it and I stayed in this hotel for 15 days in April 2010 in a queen bed room and a double double bed room (both with the bathroom). It was a nice and lovely stay. The rooms and th bathrooms were verry clean (many times I saw the cleaning women working very hard). Several times (in other cities) I had problems with sleeping (in noisy and light places), but here I had a good sleep as the neighbourhood is quiet (down to the river is a nice park at that time with blossoming and sweet-scented trees). Also the stuff at the reception was really friendly and always with a nice smile on their face, they recomend us nice places, assisted us when our luggage was lost at the airport, help us in many other ways. They did a really good job! (At that time was also the problem with vulcano erruption in Europe and there were many nervous guests and chaos in all New York.) And the metro is near, and if you pick the right train you are in 15min downtown (many people probably picked the wrong train - no1, that stops at every station and takes a little bit longer). For me and my companions was a pleasant stay!

Reviews.Title: “Dirty hotel, unhelpful staff”
Reviews.Author: pierkeley
Reviews.Content: this hotel might as well be in manhattan, but for what you get for the money they charge you might as well find a nicer hotel in brooklyn and/queens. upper west side is as near as brooklyn if you travel by metro. room was tiny and filthy. dirty shared bathrooms, with mattresses in a miserable condition. Before booking or checking make sure to check out the 'order to vacate' posted on the front door by the City of New York. Staff is just arrogant and rude. Unless you like bed mites and dealing with smug congierge, bring your business else where.

Reviews.Title: “A dump in NYC”
Reviews.Author: richardcjy
Reviews.Content: We had a terrible experience at this hotel. First of all, do not believe what their website shows. It is a shabby hotel (more like a hostel I will say). Smells bad, and the mattress is not comfortable. If you have to stay here, definitely stay away from shared bath. The front desk is not the most helpful or friendly. The guy even refused to turn on the heat, so we both suffered a pretty freezing night in early April. We had to check out early and burn my SPG points for a more decent place to stay. This almost killed our vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot”
Reviews.Author: lucytrippy
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I cam for 6 days to this hotel. It's on a quiet block which was nice, the rooms were small but the staff was friendly and the place is kept super clean. We will be back this summer for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Worst Experience Ever-Made Hostels in Europe Look Like 5 Star Hotels”
Reviews.Author: k2kara
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in various types of places all over the world and this was by far the worst. The beds were dirty and hard, the bathroom had pubic hairs, the elevator door had blood in it and to top matters off after we complained to the front desk someone entered are room at approximately 4:00 a.m. during the first night we were there. We promptly checked out and paid extra to stay at a Holiday Inn up 3 blocks. After calling management to ask for a refund for the 2 nights we did not stay we were laughed at.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel In New York”
Reviews.Author: shark2201
Reviews.Content: I have been visiting New York for some time now, and this winter I brought along friends to show them around. This hotel was so bad it was embarrassing. We stayed during the big blizzard this past December and the steam radiator clicked and whistled all night. No one slept. They gave our original room away and I had to argue with them in order to get our two bed order back. The hotel is near the 96th St subway and it is in a quiet, decent part of town... and the price tends to lure you in with the high prices you experience else where. However, THIS HOTEL ISN'T WORTH THE MONEY. The mattresses were about as comfortable as the floor, with no exaggeration. The TV has about three channels and the heating system has no individual control: you're at the mercy of steam room at the bottom of the building. I would stress to anyone that unless it's the only place left in town, spend your money elsewhere.... at least during the winter.

Reviews.Title: “good experience!”
Reviews.Author: SG529
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Hotel Alexander for one night with my husband and 2 year old. I found the staff very pleasant, the rooms warm (while it was about 20 degrees outside) and everything very clean and comfortable. I would definitely recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Freezing cold...the radiator never worked properly....”
Reviews.Author: MysticTraveller_8
Reviews.Content: We spent the christmas week at Hotel Alexander. It is in close proximity to the subways, which made getting around quite easy. The hotel room is very basic. We stayed in an ensuite room with a queen bed. The bathrooms are very clean. However the shower enclosure is so tiny that we could bare fit to take a shower. The elevator is as small as other readers stated, with it bare enough to hold one person and one luggage. The corridors had a really bad scent. The biggest complaint and I notice other guests were complaing about is the heat. The room was freezing...The radiator did not work properly at all...It was very uncomfortable. Also some friends booked as well but when they arrived at 6.00 in the morning the hotel said they cancelled their bookings and they were already filled. They recommended the Belnord hotel. We understand that this is always an issue with hotel alexander. Overall on my next visit, I would probably stay somewhere a little bit cozier closer to times square...

Reviews.Title: “What you pay for is what you get”
Reviews.Author: Kathryn_Sloanes
Reviews.Content: The hotel was quite basic- it had an almost hostel- like feel to it. The room was relatively small and the decor was dated, but it was clean and fit for purpose. The ensuite was pristine and newly installed. The hotel is located quite far uptown (West 94th Street) away from the buzz of the more central locations like Times Square (42nd street), but it was very close by to the nearest subway station (96th st) and this came every few minutes, making it easy to get to the heart of the action. We only had one hiccup in our stay here. On the day we attended our friend's wedding (Oct 27th) the hot water supply failed and was not fixed all afternoon and when we called reception, I felt that we were 'bothering' them when they were already aware of the problem. It wasn't the end of the world, but it did lead to us feeling fairly uncomfortable at having not been able to freshen up fully for our friends' big day. We didn't even really get anything by way of an apology. Having said that, the rest of the time the staff were incredibly helpful. Also, the hotel was pretty cheap in comparison to anything else I was able to find in NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Completely misrepresented on the website”
Reviews.Author: blubelle147
Reviews.Content: The hotel was NOTHING like it appeared to be on the website. The rooms were heated with a steam radiator on the floor that whistled steam out with a piercing sound. The shower had no door or curtain and the beds might as well have been two box springs on top of one another they were so hard. The elevator was so small two people and luggage BARELY fit. The front desk although friendly was not entirely helpful. After reading the other reviews it seems I didn't get a newly renovated room with a view...the two windows in my room each faced a brick building. There were no inside locks on the doors and the smell throughout the halls was less then pleasant. I never saw a lounge with a TV or coffee as is stated on the website. The rooms were pretty bare without even a hair dryer. The neighborhood appeared safe and the subway was about a block and a half away. Coming into and out of the city was easy with this location.

Reviews.Title: “Worst experience of NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Lucyingemann
Reviews.Content: We arrived at this hotel and a group of young Asian travelers were at the concierge who were being told they had no record of their booking and were sent away. We then were also told that we had no room although they did have a record of our booking, but had failed to bother informing us of this! As we were very angry, it being thanksgiving eve and not knowing were else to go to at such late notice we were quite concerned and cross. As it happens, the owner of the hotel overheard our complaints and somehow managed to give us a room, but said the room was meant to be under 'construction' due to the bathroom being renovated. To cut this long story short, this was satisfactory problem resolving from the owners part and we were grateful for his help. But in the morning, we both woke up with our bodies totally covered with bed bug bites which was a totally hideous and awful thing which haunted me with itchy sores until we came home to Australia. Obviously this room was condemned and should never have been given to anyone. If you haven't been bitten by bedbugs before, it is truly a disgusting experience and i wouldn't wish it on anyone. Very disappointed and haunted by this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Inexpensive hotel, excellent location, can't go wrong!”
Reviews.Author: TheHappyChappie
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Alexander is an inexpensive, budget hotel located in a leafy, residential area of the Upper West. The hotel offers rooms to suit all traveler's needs, from dorms to rooms with shared facilities to recently renovated en-suited doubles. Our stay was in the latter. The room is cleaned and serviced daily. Reception is staffed 24 hours, and was proved fast and efficient. We arrived about 10pm and were in our room within ten minutes. Free WiFi, as well as tea and coffee making facilities are provided in the lounge. Baggage storage is available at a nominal charge ($2 per bag). The location of the hotel provides easy access to the subway. 96th Street station is just over a block away and can be accessed at 94th/Broadway. It is on the express line meaning you can be in Times Square in about ten minutes. The nearby avenues of Broadway and Amsterdam contain many eating and drinking opportunities. If you fancy a walk then Central Park is only four blocks away. The Guggenheim, on museum mile, is a further short, and very enjoyable walk across Central Park. All in all, staying at the Hotel Alexander was a pleasurable experience that won't break the bank!

Reviews.Title: “50/50”
Reviews.Author: GlasgowBadger77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Alexander as a result of the price and a recommendation from a friend. Our room was a superior with queen bed which was extremely tight to say the least. You do expect smaller rooms in NYC but this felt especially small. The queen bed was a good size and comfortable and the bathroom was modern and finished well but the room was just not big enough for the bed and then all our things. I actually ended up stacking all my clothes on the window ledge which also acted to block the draft from the windows. On that we asked about the heating due to it feeling pretty cold most of the time. We were told that the heating was on but it worked only in short bursts and to wait for the gift of heat with bated breath. I did get a bad feeling when the reception staff then offered me blankets if it was still too cold. When the heating didn't come on after 2 days we gave up until one night about 2 am it burst into life sounding like a helicopter landing in our room. We quickly turned it off to avoid the pending explosion. Our biggest problem came on the Saturday night which was the night before me and my wife were getting up at 5.30am to run the NYC marathon. There appeared to be a party going on just down our corridor which involved lots of drunk loud people shouting and slamming doors! Annoying at the best of times but with 26 miles of torture ahead we were particularly annoyed to be lying awake at 1am. We complained several times and to be fair the solo night staff member did try and shut them up but it still took several hours for it all to eventually die down. We had planned to kick up a fuss the next day but the marathon drained us of all ability to communicate. With all the negativity dealt with the hotel is in a lovely part of the city with the subway and lots of shops restaurants etc only a few blocks away. The key west diner on broadway is particularly good for breakfast as we found out almost every day. The hotel was also kept particularly clean with a team of staff buzzin around every morning. Most of the staff at reception also appeared to want to help with any problems and were for the most part friendly. As alot of other reviews have mentioned you do get what you pay for and when you compare the price to other hotels you definitely save alot by staying here. If you are on a budget I would definitely recommend this hotel as long as you are not expecting luxury. For all the time you are in your room on a trip to NYC it does feel like throwing alot of money at a hotel is a waste but this is down to personal preference. Overall you might be lucky with one of the bigger rooms and no parties keeping you up all night. It's a gamble worth taking for the cash you will save in my opinion!!

Reviews.Title: “A very bad surprise”
Reviews.Author: MartiniMex
Reviews.Content: My wife & me choose this hotel for the good comments we saw on internet We booked a double room with private bathroom (strongly specified at the moment of the reservation). Once we arrived for the check-in (very late in the night), we were told that our room was with shared bathroom; anyway the assured me to solve the problem within the following morning, so we decided to stay The following morning the guy in charge told me that no room with private bathroom was not available for few days I made my complaint, very strongly: they accepted ON PURPOSE a reservation they already knew they could not honour. They really didn't care about my protest, telling me that NYC was very big and I could find another hotel (unbelievable!!!) So we left the hotel very angry, fortunately the vacation came back to the normality when we found a respectablaeBest Western near Times Square

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, but....”
Reviews.Author: WaywardOn
Reviews.Content: it does have its downside. From their website, everything looked good, until I went in. Didn't realize in NY you don't have private bathrooms in your room. Beds were hard as rock at best, and there was no parking, except the street parking or garage next door. anyways, you get what you pay for. Staff was alright, location is decent, and there's a lot of convenient stores just blocks away. I'd recommend it if traveling on a budget, but if you have the money to spend, check elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap, cheerful and clean...”
Reviews.Author: Gazza67
Reviews.Content: Have recently spent a week here, as a solo traveller and it was perfect for my needs... As I said it was cheap and with no frills... But the room was just right and very clean, I had a shared bathroom which again was very clean an there were no issues on the sharing, I never had to wait - it was always available. The front desk was always staffed, they were always helpful and nothing was too much trouble... Not that I had any issues - needed a taxi for airport, asked for directions, was allowed access to phone (free of charge) and was allowed to stow my luggage for a few hours on the last day. The common area, with free coffee and wi-fi was open from 7am-10pm it also had internet access $1 for 10mins so for the times I need to access it was easy and convenient. The lift was possibly the smallest and slowest in New York City and a couple of times I got a strange whiff of something in the corridor - but nothing in the room at all. Outside the hotel was 2 blocks from the nearest metro station and bus stop, which was on 'Broadway' (the main road you can walk down - if you so wish - to get into lower Manhatten and all the sights) where there is a vast choice of restaurants/bars and shops. On the whole an ideal place to stay for a visit to New York... I read a few reviews before and chose this place because of its positive 'cleanliness' reviews... I was very pleasantly supprised considering the budget price of the hotel. I will return to New York in a year or so with my Girlfriend and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Our Daughter's Wedding...Perfect Weekend, Including the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bridal-Mother
Reviews.Content: Our daughter was married in the Upper West Side on Nov 8, 2009. There were 180 people coming to the wedding, many coming from all over the country and staying 3 nights. I had heard about the NYC hotel prices and was afraid some people would not come to the wedding if 3 nights in a hotel was beyond their budget (especially in this economy). I looked at the hotel website, and was impressed with the look of the building and the fact that the bedrooms were newly renovated. My husband and I live in Connecticut and made a trip in to see it in person and meet the Manager. He was extremely helpful and showed us the renovated rooms. He said they were done by designers (and it looked it). The bathrooms in the rooms were all stone and the tiles on the floor had a rubber safety surface. I understand that there are rooms with bathrooms in the hall, but obviously we were only interested in renovated rooms with private baths. We did not see any of those hall bathrooms while we were there. During the weekend I asked our guests if they liked their rooms. I did not hear one bad thing. They mentioned the contemporary design of the rooms and how clean the hotel was...we went back to the hotel several times during the day in the course of the weekend between wedding events, and always saw the cleaning staff carrying vacuum cleaners and continually cleaning. Our guests (many of whom could have stayed in much more pricy hotels in NYC) wanted to stay with us so the family could all be together. I took a chance by going with the Hotel Alexander, and it was a big factor in our perfect wedding weekend! It did not have the amenities of the pricier hotels, but there was a wonderful cafe right up the street that served as our hotel restaurant. Two children married, one to go (ha)...

Reviews.Title: “DON'T STAY THERE!!”
Reviews.Author: speedbird77W
Reviews.Content: They probably don't have the room available you booked! And they don't care about that!! They are not even interested in any customer satisfaction! We stayed for five nights and had to change rooms twice (!!!), so stayed in three different rooms!! Of course we got NO compensation for that, just bold comments from the unfriendly and incompetent stuff. Need more? Couldn't regulate heating, toilet continous clogged, remote wasn't working, shower unserviceable, .... and so on. DON'T STAY THERE!!

Reviews.Title: “Biggest rooms in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: meghan00
Reviews.Content: I was shocked at how big my room was and at such a great price! I've been coming to NYC for a yearly shopping trip since 2000 and a friend recommended Hotel Alexander to me based on the location. This was by far the my best stay for my money in the past 9 years! The staff was very friendly and accommodating from Housekeeping to Concierge! I needed help with directions and the staff was extremely helpful and patient with me! I will definitely be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad if you get the room you Reserve (DO NOT STAY HERE)”
Reviews.Author: Mark_W76
Reviews.Content: Just got back from NYC yesterday and would not recommend Hotel Alexander to anyone. There were many family members already staying here when we arrived for a wedding in the neighborhood. My family had reserved renovated rooms and these rooms were very nice with nice beds. My girlfriend and I had reserved a renovated room with a queen bed and private bath. The staff at the front desk knew this but quickly told us that a city inspector had to come out to inspect the rooms the next day and thought they would have our room available for us the next evening. The staff put us up in a non-renovated room with one double bed and one single bed with a shared bathroom. The bed didn't have a matress pad on it and you could see the matress through the sheets and the comforter was torn. The room was very depressing and gross and the bed was in front of the room door so it was easy to run into the bed on entering the room. The bathroom was clean at night before we went to bed but was nasty in the morning. We had to get ready for a wedding in this shared bath. The next morning we asked the staff about our room and were told that we would not get it that night either. We were continually "put off" by the staff. When asked about the city inspector there was a look of question/confusion on the staff member's face. We are pretty sure by this point they were lying to us. More of my family arrived on that day and they received their reserved rooms (renovated king with private bath). I would recommend staying here if you get what you reserved but if you are reserving a renovated room do not count on getting it. DO NOT STAY HERE!!! We were supposed to stay here for three nights and ended up only making it one. We left after we could not get our room the second night and went to the six columbus on 58th street, which was awesome.

Reviews.Title: “They Overbooked all the time”
Reviews.Author: Vieillechaussette
Reviews.Content: I had a reservation and when I arrived at the hotel, with my confirmation number, my credit card and all the paper work, they told me that they didn't have anything for me, that I had to find a place somewhere else, on a holiday weekend. After a small fight with the manager, he found me another place, a lot more expensive, and on the other side of the town. The manager was a total liar and he told me many lies to get rid of me (that I would have the same price per night at the other hotel, etc.). The employee at the other hotel (Chelsea Hotel), was very kind and told me that he was working at the Hotel Alexander a few months a go. He told me that they overbooked all the time and that some room where very old and had bugs. The guy told me that the overbooked problem was a recurrent problem and he quit the job at the hotel because he can't lie anymore to the customers.

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Garotis
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 nights in October. We were a little worried with previous comments, but everything was ok. The hotel is in a nice and quite area. The substation is very near and convenient. There are many restaurants and coffees around. Besides that, the shared bathrooms were always clean and free. It is ok, I agree with another people, the staff is not so friendly or helpful, but we had no problems. The room is small, but we were not interested in the room in NY. The most important for us is the location and the safety. We booked by internet and the price was very nice, cheaper than other similar hotels in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap for NYC - but I guess you get what u pay for”
Reviews.Author: Flooks
Reviews.Content: The renovated ensuite rooms are quite nice with contemporary facilties akin to a 3 star hotel - if you manage to score one. Unfortunately this hotel does not guarantee the room type, even if you specify and select 'renovated room' in the reservation. I stayed for 6 nights and was lucky to get the renovated room I reserved, however, upon returning to NYC for one night at a later date, I was put into an ordinary/unrenovated room, even though I requested a renovated one. Unfortunately the cleaning staff are not consistent. I left the 'please clean room' sign on the door and upon return, I found they took the towels, emptied the bins and made the bed but did not provide new towels or a roll of toilet paper. There is just one lift and it is used by everyone, including cleaning staff so sometimes you have to wait ages for a lift, particularly during the day. I think the walls in the room are quite thin, though I was lucky I did not have noisy neighbours. The reception staff were ok, except for one who was abrupt - to the point of being discourteous. I was irritated that I had to notify this reception staff member that the ordinary room was not the one I reserved before he updated the charge to the lower rate for an unrenovated room. A renovated room was unavailable even though that's what I booked months ago. If I had not said anything I would have paid a higher rate for an unrenovated room and I feel that was a little sneaky if not dishonest. There is a $2 charge for storing luggage for the day upon checkout - which I think is a little stingy. The ordinary unrenovated ensuite rooms are ok if you're staying for one night. They have basic but adequate facilities - just everything is a little 'old', except for the TV which is a flat screen. They have internet available but there is a charge for minute (though no more expensive than any other place in NYC). Internet cafes/outlets are rare in NYC - they have places with one or 2 'internet booths' which charge by the minute but across the board, internet is expensive in NYC. Wireless internet is more readily available in NYC - but ofcourse you need to have your own laptop. The location of the hotel is good, a metro station is within walking distance and there is a side street vendor nearby selling nice and cheap mexican takeaway. Although cheap for NYC, the price is not 'cheap' and this hotel did not meet some basic expectations. If I returned to NYC I'm not sure I'd bother with the attitude (of this particular staff member) and lack of consistency of this hotel; I'd prefer to pay more to stay in a better place.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: jen1933
Reviews.Content: We stayed in September for 4 nights. We paid for a private bathroom, no towels, no hot water. Small poky hot room with noisy air con. Bed was ripped. The manager was never at the desk through out the night. Felt unsafe. Money making hotel is all they care about. YOU HAVE BEEN WARNED. If you opt for a shared bathroom, I saw a lot of bugs running around.

Reviews.Title: “I was pleasantly surprised”
Reviews.Author: washdcdave
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay, I was on the 3rd floor facing the street and had a room with 2 windows. The bed was a double and the mattress a little hard for my liking but I slept OK. There was a desk and chair and then another chair an armoire and a flat screen TV. There wwere also 2 end tables. The bathroom was the best part as it seemd to have been remodeled recently and was very nice and lots of hot water. The hotel is convenient to places to eat and 2 blocks from the subway that will take you right downtown. Based on some other reviews I was skeptical and figured it's just one night so how bad can it be. I was pleasnrly surprised and I hope you are too.

Reviews.Title: “Great Deal for the Price”
Reviews.Author: sss07
Reviews.Content: We were a little apprehensive after reading some of the reviews of this hotel, but it was great! Mostly very clean and a nice, safe room in a good location of the city. ONE TIP: Make sure to print out your reservation confirmation as that will help a lot in check in. The woman checking in before us had a lot of trouble because she didn't have her confirmation and they seemed to have lost her reservation (she got it worked out eventually, but it looked like a headache). The desk people are not very helpful, this is the only downside of this place. They seem to like talking on their cell phones more than helping guests. Check in and out, and otherwise don't bother them and you'll enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good NYC alternative”
Reviews.Author: RoamingFromBoston
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a reasonable place to stay in Manhatten and this seemed a good bet. We chose the renovated room with two Queen beds and were very pleased with the comfort and cleanliness. Hostel prices but better quality. We phoned ahead to inform them that we would arrive in the middle of the night and they held our room as promised and checked us in at 2am. The desk staff on duty throughout our staff were always friendly. I don't believe they have a full maintenance staff so when we had no hot water in our private bath, we were forced to use the shared facility because there were no other comparable rooms available and we didn't want to give up our two beds. Short of running into dripping people wrapped scantily in towels, running between shared shower and their rooms, we had no real complaints. The neighborhood is safe and quiet and restaurant selection is wide. Proximity to Riverside Park, Central Park and the subway are all nice features.

Reviews.Title: “What a pleasant surprise!”
Reviews.Author: dgoldyn
Reviews.Content: There was not a room to be found in NYC anywhere for less than $500 per night and I found the alexander. I read the reviews and went not expecting much. What a stroke of luck! They renovated the rooms (50% of them are done to date) and the room is modern, clean and great. Did I mention very quiet for New York? It's one block from the subway. Only negatives: bathroom on the small side- the front desk is a little curtn But still a great find. Comfortable bed. Make sure to ask for a renovated room/

Reviews.Title: “Great value - nice place”
Reviews.Author: maxwellbetti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Alexander for one week in May 2009 and were very satisfied with the whole experience. Staff was friendly and helpful, the Hotel very clean. Although it is not located in typical tourist Manhattan, the Upper Westside is an enjoyable area and subway connection to all downtown sights is excellent. Around 94th Street Broadway offers a huge amount of places for breakfast or dinner - coming home late at night (by subway) did not feel unsafe or risky at all. Note that many rooms of the hotel face to the tiny (!) courtyard, and as we preferred the/a street view, we changed rooms after one night. Although the second room was not newly renovated, it was still in good condition and comparable to places which are a lot more expensive in downtown Manhattan.

Reviews.Title: “Bed bugs, gross bathrooms, rude manager- not worth the $. better places for the price.”
Reviews.Author: smason4
Reviews.Content: Hotel Alexander Pros: Friendly, helpful staff Decent sized room TV in room Room is relatively clean (except for some evidence of bed bugs) Great location- 2 blocks from an express station Low traffic area Up to fire code (except for the Carbon Monoxide detector hanging disassembled in the hallway) Cons: Evidence of bed bugs - Staff told us they brought home bed bugs (from the lobby...with no luggage to transport them) - After discovering evidence of bed bugs (at about 11pm), we immediately insisted on checking out and heading to the airport as our flight was the next day. The receptionist advised us to wait until the manager arrived the next morning so that he could refund our entire stay. After waiting for ten hours (without sleeping mind you) the manager attempted to avoid us. The receptionist said he was â€œtoo busyâ€� on Monday mornings to deal with customers. I informed the receptionist that we would mention this avoidance in our review of Hotel Alexander. Suddenly (as if he was listening), the manager appeared from behind his office door. He offered us a one night refund- barely enough to cover the cost of the insecticides we had purchased to treat our clothing and luggage. He took our contact information and promised to contact us if any additional refund was possible. It has been over a month and guess what? He never even attempted to do so. Dirty bathrooms - I've stayed in hostels before and have no problem sharing a bathroom; however, these were beyond disgusting. Several families appeared to be living in the hotel and they took very poor care of these community areas. There was almost always an unbelievable amount of urine EVERYWHERE. This was in addition to the masses of hair and the occasional undrained, dirty tub. The urine smell emanated throughout the entire hall throughout most of our stay. I thought I was going to vomit every time I walked to my room. The maids clean the bathrooms every morning but this is not enough. No locks on the windows - We stayed in two separate rooms during our 5 night stay and neither had locks on the windows. Worst of all, in the "10" rooms (110, 210,310....) the windows lead directly out the fire escape. The hall window, which was always open, also eads to the same fire escape. It would be very easy for someone to quickly pass from the hallway window and into our rooms. No safe in room - Although in-room safes are an advertised amenity on Hotel Alexander's website, there wasn't one in either of our 2 rooms. (false advertisement). Key cards never work - Electronic key cards demagnetized at least once a day. The receptionist told us to just have our cards recoded each time we came through the lobby. As you can image, this quickly became a nuisance. On one occasion, I checked my key card to make sure it was working before I got in the shower. When I got out of the shower, my card had demagnetized. I was locked out of my room standing in only a towel until my spouse (in a towel also) made it down to the front desk to have our cards reprogrammed. Like other reviewer's have mentioned, the a/c unit is extremely loud and the free internet is only available from 7am to 10pm. Overall, I wouldn't recommend this place to a friend. There are many hostels in the area that are cheaper, cleaner and offer more amenities.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING AND CHEAP!!”
Reviews.Author: lecarlos
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was a little worried about staying here. Well the hotel turned out to be AWESOME. Yes, this might not be your five star hotel, but if you are on a budget this hotel is for you. The room was clean and the bed was comfy enough. I was surprised on how clean the bathroom was which was shared with a few other rooms on the floor. The area is safe and the hotel is a block away from the subway station. There is a CVS, RiteAid and a bunch of restaurants within walking distance too. Overall I had a wonderful experience and will definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN. Bug problem, disgusting beds, front desk was RUDE RUDE RUDE!!”
Reviews.Author: angelakazemi
Reviews.Content: Me, my sister, and mother, stayed at the hotel hoping to at least be content for the price we were paying. DEFINITELY NOT. First off, we could never even get ahold of the front desk! We had to drive around in a taxi trying to figure out the address because the front desk would not answer their phone. We had called the night before to get the address with the same result. When we got there, our room looked digusting, there were stains all over the carpet, the walls, and the sheets!! There was hair in my bed the first night which was definitely not mine! One of the beds was tilted?! My sister slid over to me every night! Their was a window unit air conditioning, however it was freezing cold! The first night we had bugs that came in through the cracks. We told the front desk the next day and they basically ignored our problem and said that they may change our room. Later they had someone come with "bug spray" to spray down the room.. guess what the bug spray was?.. FEBREZE. Not even kidding. The elevator was HORRIBLE. It was suppose to be "renovated" but yeah I'm sure it was the cheapest one they could get. It was super small and stopped at every floor, whether there was someone there or not. 2 out of 3 nights, our room key did not work! Surprisingly, I have to admit that the bathroom (for being shared) was clean, and the location of the hotel was excellent. (2 subway stops from time square and close to central park, etc.) But as for everything else, it needs some work! Definitely would recommend to pay a bit more and stay at a decent hotel and not this run down place.

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel for budget travellers”
Reviews.Author: TREllis2k
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights in July. Hotel is extremely well priced for NYC and perfect for a couple who don't mind sharing a bathroom. The location is excellent for sighseeing around NYC and is only a couple of blocks from the 96th street subway. The rooms a little tired and tatty, however very clean and most certainly the best you can get for this price in New York. Staff were friendly and helpful upon checkout. Luggage can be stored in a room next to the reception if you have a late flight. The coffee / tv room was useful as we had a late flight on the last day so spent time sight seeing and then chilled out for an hour in the tv room. Wireless internet was available however I didn't use it (I think you needed to pay). All in all a great hotel for the budget traveller who doesn't want to slum it in a hostel.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here!”
Reviews.Author: chimpmo
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms on Hotel Alexander's own website, one with two double beds and the other room with two single beds. We had recieved the confirmation email. Arrived at the hotel at 8pm to find out they had one room for us with one double bed. Bearing in mind they had all our details and knew that there was five of us, they still only offered us one bed for five people. The receptionist was very unhelpful, saying we had to sort it out in the morning with the manager. We then had to spend hours looking on the extremely slow internet and ringing around trying to find somewhere to stay with no help from the hotel. The hotel made a major mistake and did not even attempt to fix the problem!!!! Whilst we were searching for somewhere to stay, a mother with her two teenage daughters turned up and the hotel had put them in a room with one single bed. We found somewhere eventually at 1am with no help whatsoever from the hotel staff. This place is a joke, if you book a room pre-trip don't expect it to be there!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT Location, Great value for money”
Reviews.Author: Emetta
Reviews.Content: I have to start with the location. It was unbeatable for this price. We were on a budget and not expecting much form the hotel but the location said it all. The room was air conditioned and we had a private bath. All clean and size was good for what we were paying. We booked a private bath and double room and when we got there, we had our private bath with not one but two double beds which was great value!! Unbeatable location again, right at central park and just a few mins walk to subway. I definatly would give it a 9/10!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic value for money”
Reviews.Author: TravelLife82
Reviews.Content: The Hotel Alexander provided us with exactly what we were after - a safe, clean, value for money hotel in a good location. The room was small but it was clean, towels were provided and there was a television. We had a room without a bathroom, but I never once had to wait to use the bathroom and they were clean. Once or twice the bathroom was a little untidy but that is the fault of other guests not the hotel, as it's impossible for the cleaners to clean up after every use! A bit of common courtesy for others is required when using a share bathroom! The hotel was a 5 minute walk to the 96th street subway station, and you could be in Times Square in 10 minutes. There was also heaps of restaurants nearby on Broadway and Amsterdam. Reception were friendly enough, and there was a lounge type room with internet ($1 for 10 mins) and free coffee.
