Overall, a great experience and I wouldn't hesitate recommending this to anyone looking for good budget accommodation in New York.

Reviews.Title: “goog bargin”
Reviews.Author: LondonAli123
Reviews.Content: I sayed here at the end of may with my boyfriend for five days. I knew the hotel was basic and was pleasntly surprised. The hotel is in a fansatic location and only a few minutes walk from the subway. The hotel was clean and most importanly so were the shared bathrooms. The hotel was only half full during our stay and as a result had the bathroom to ourself. The bathrooms are cleaned throughout the day and we never had any complaints. The only down side was we had no view from the window in our room with very little day light as a result ,but not all rooms have this problem. Over all it was a goof hotel worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Stay away from this awful place”
Reviews.Author: annamillais
Reviews.Content: I traveled to the Alexander in March 09 with my boyfriend. We are young folk from Canada looking to do sight-seeing and what-not, not expecting a romantic getaway or bells and whistles. We are very very simple people, we were not expecting much out of this place except a quiet safe place to sleep. 3 weeks before our trip I phoned them to confirm my reservation. The person on the other side of the phone said "call tomorrow and ask for the reservation department". There is no reservation department, he was just trying to get me to go away. I would soon learn that staff at The Alexander would use this "come back later" line A LOT. Finally after frequent phone calls they confirmed my room, 1 queen bed and private bath. Once we arrived, the indifferent person at the front desk show us to our room, which was on the ground floor off the lobby. The room had 2 twin beds. Not exactly what a young couple were looking for. We told this to the front desk who said he had no power to change this and to get it corrected in the morning, "ask in the morning" he said. What service. After wasting our time explaining the situation to the morning reception guy, he told us to go on with our day and once we are back everything will be moved. At this point we knew better and told them to move it now, and reluctantly they moved our things with us standing there, this time to a room with two queen beds. Not exactly what we wanted but we were exhausted with going back and forth with these people. The first night in this room was horrible, the heater would not stop making a noise which resembled bloody murder, and kept us up all night, and the neighbors (all of them) had a habit of slamming their doors whenever leaving and entering their rooms. To add to this the window did not open properly, so when we had to let some cold air in (BECAUSE THE HEATER WOULD NOT TURN OFF), it was a struggle. In addition, the walls were urine-color yellow, the wallpaper was winkled and peeling off the wall, obviously a product of a leak in the floor above and the hotel not caring. At some point we could only find all this amusing, as an attempt to not let it ruin our trip. What was there to do? Cancel and walk out onto the streets of New York hoping to find another hotel with a spot for us? When the front desk was presented with the simple question of "where is my tv remote", they repeatedly said "when you come back it'll be in your room". This happened for 3 days. Finally we got into a rile with them regarding this and it finally got resolved. The hotel is located near a subway station, which is nice but something not hard to come by in NYC. There are places that charge the same price as this dump and A LOT MORE FRIENDLY, RELIABLE, USEFUL, and won't flake out on you regarding every concern. I would never recommend this place to a friend unless I wanted them to be annoyed to the point of contemplating suicide. Beware of The Alexander!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Bring ear plugs and aspirins”
Reviews.Author: Mookie2009
Reviews.Content: very loud hotel, tiny elevator which hardly worked, lots of kids running in the hall and slamming doors at all hours of the night. Next door we had unstable people yelling and slamming doors at 2:40 am. Strange person in the elevator too. Not coming back, I would rather pay more. Never had such a head ache in my life.

Reviews.Title: “worked for me. good price good location”
Reviews.Author: iamtraveller
Reviews.Content: i liked my stay at this hotel more so because I got this almost half the price compared to everything else I could see anywhere in New York for my 4 night stay. good: Subway is right there. Street 96 is a stop for express trains and has an exit on Street 94 west which is close to to the hotel. Bathrooms were mostly clean. It never happenned that I did not find the bathroom available when I needed it. In fact I never felt someone else was using it. Except on the weekend when I did see few hair in the bath tub. But it has to do with how others are leaving the bathroom. Rom was small but good for a couple in the given price. I did not face any difficulty die to the size of the room. The market neat the hotel has everything that you need from grocery to radio shack. Not that they promised but there is no internet in the room which would have been nice. However there was internet in the lounge from 7AM to 10PM. When I needed after 10PM, I used to sit outside the lounge in a small chair next to vending machines where I did get internet. There was some problem with the room keys and they would not work once every day, For me this happenned 4 times in 4 days. The elevator worked but in rush hours there was a long wait time. Overall I had a nice stay.

Reviews.Title: “Unaccepatable, left the hotel after one night”
Reviews.Author: Munich39
Reviews.Content: Service: I had booked a Room with two twin beds and private bath two months before the trip. Despite my protests, I was given a room without private bathroom at my arrival. Even though I showed my booking confirmation, the staff was not helpful or at least interested. He stubbornly declared that it's this room or no room at all. Allegedly no room with private bathroom was available. Since it was late in the evening, I took the room. The general manager is not at the hotel except for two or three hours in the mornings, and not at weekends. And the receptionists do absolutely nothing. The only lift was out of order. Cleanliness: The shared bathroom was mostly clean, the room itself and especially the beds were not. Towels, sheets and bedspread were full of holes and showed stains. Very icky. I checked out the next morning. On top of everything, they tried to charge me for a room with private bathroom, but I didn't have a private bathroom! My friends also stayed at the Hotel Alexander and also checked out directly after one night, mainly because of the not clean rooms and the not working lift. Location: Location is good. Only two blocks from the subway and close to shops, groceries and eateries. Nice and safe neighbourhood. Summary: avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel for this money”
Reviews.Author: Katyazest
Reviews.Content: We've booked one room with private bath and two queen sized bads for 3 people. The total cost was about $380 for each (with hotel discounts). It's a very good price for such a hotel in Manhetten. It's located near the subway station and not far from Central park. The neighbourhood is good. Everyday our room was cleaned which means that our towel were changed, our bad was changed, our garbage was discarded. The only complain is that the floor was vacuumed only once during 8 days. The view from the windows was to the walls neighbouring buildings but who needs the view in the cheap hotel which you use only as a place to sleep? :) The staff is very nice and helpfull. You can always have free coffe or tea and free wi-fi in cozy and clean lobby (there is no wi-fi in the rooms). Also it wpolud be nice if hotel had it's own parking.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money, basic hotel”
Reviews.Author: GillD28
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we were looking for a reasonably cheapish hotel in New York (and by New York prices, this is cheap!). We just needed somewhere to sleep and shower - after all we didn't go to New York to stay in the hotel room! We went for a room with a shared bathroom because it was considerably cheaper than having a private bathroom. There was never a problem with this, and only 1 morning out of 5 did I ever find anyone else in it - and that just meant a 2 minute wait till they'd done. Main Advantages: - Hotel Alex is very reasonably priced - It's in a good location (1 block from the subway, close enough to the hustle and bustle without being too close). From here it's about 10-15 minutes on the train to Times Square. - The hotel was basic but clean. The rooms were an OK size, and had their own TV. - Hotel Alex is a 5 minute walk (maybe 10, depending on how fast you walk) to Central Park which is lovely to visit on a lazy Sunday afternoon. Main disadvantages (which were not major in my eyes): - The staff could have been a bit friendlier and helpful - after all, the odd 'please', 'thank you', 'good morning' and 'have a nice day', and even the odd smile do not cost anything. They weren't rude, but just didn't really give you that nice warm feeling you get from staying in a good hotel. For example, when we checked in the man handed us our room keys and then turned round have a drink, without saying the usual 'your room's on the ground floor, through the doors and turn right, have a nice stay'. Just seemed a little abrupt. But then in my eyes this is not a major flaw considering you get a cheap hotel. - The bathroom floors became very wet at times (from the shower/condensation), which made them quite slippy. However, we just asked the cleaning lady for an extra hand towel and used this as a bath mat. - Our room didn't have a huge amount of storage space, but did have 2 cupboards (1 of which was actually a v small room - I suspect orginally intended to be the toilet but was carpeted and had no plumbing). The only small problem with 2 big cupboards was that they could have done with having some shelves in them or some kind of storage device. - There was no safe in the room (I don't know if there may have been any at reception), but having said that, this is America, you need your passport and money to get a drink, and your camera to take photos, so other than maybe some paperwork (tickets/insurance) it's not a problem. We just left these (and a couple of MP3 players and some English Â£) in the hotel room and they were prefectly safe (having said that we left the 'do not disturb' sign on the door all holiday - mainly because we didn't feel the need to get new towels and sheets for just 5 nights stay - you know, doing our bit for the environment and all!). None of these negative points were really an issue - after all you get what you pay for, and when I go on a long weekend city break I don't plan to spend much time in my hotel room! Overall, I would recommend this hotel if you want a relatively cheap place to stay in New York, and aren't too bothered about it being a little basic.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel experience of my life”
Reviews.Author: Canucky_9
Reviews.Content: Booked two rooms in advance for 5 people but when we got there we had not been allocated the correct rooms or number of beds and they seemed to have no record of our booking. The receptionist could not have cared less and offered us a partially constructed room in the basement. Ended up cancelling and frantically searching around for another hotel on the snail paced internet at the hotel. Do not book to stay at this hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel but terrible staff working there!”
Reviews.Author: Pix00
Reviews.Content: Well i stayed in a double room with a shared bathroom, everything was good very clean towels, etc, except for the people that works in the Hotel i had a reservation that one of my friends reconfirmed before we arrived and when we got there with a reservation printed the guy at the front desk told us there was not such reservation, we got there at 3 am and he didnt want to give us a room saying he didnt have nothing available, after begin him for like 40 mins he finally gave us a room...so he was lying before...anyway like i said the hotel is great clean and good located but the people in the front desk were TERRIBLE next day i saw they were doing the same to some people that just arrived and the recepcionist was very rude..besides that its a nice place!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for the price”
Reviews.Author: BLUEVINYLMASTER
Reviews.Content: This is the best budget hotel Ive stayed in. The price is fantastic. It is clean and safe. My room was one with a shared bathroom, This was the first time ive shared a bathroom so did not really know what to expect but I found it to be no problem. They were clean and always vacant as most rooms have there own bathrooms. I think we was quite fortunate with our room as it was on the 6th floor and faced the street, I seen some of the rooms which had no kind of a view so the review could be different if I had stayed in one of them. Our room was clean and larger then I thought it was going to be. Staff were friendly and helpfull, no problems at all. The location is a bit out of the way (94th St W) but the 96th subway is minutes away with the red line which goes all the way to brooklyn and stops at all the tourist places i.e. columbus, times sq & nr the world trade site. The subway is $2 for 1 single fare, I suggest a metro card if your there for more then a day or the $7 for 4 rides. Theres deli's banks, drugstores, maccies, dunkin d's a block away most 24hr Ive stayed in NY a few times now and even thought this hotel is not luxuary you just cant beat the price and Il be staying here again. *pics to follow once ive uploaded

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel on a budget”
Reviews.Author: Inkblotspot
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Alexander on our first trip to NYC. After trawling the web for reasonably priced, well located hotels in Manhattan, we stumbled across this one and were very happy we did. The staff were attentive and friendly, the room was clean and comfortable, and the price was reasonable. It wasnt a five star establishment - but then it doesnt claim to be. For the most part, when we're traveling overseas, all a hotel needs to be is safe and clean - somewhere to rest while exploring the city. Hotel Alexander was great for this - we always felt welcome, always felt safe, and it was in a great location - close enough to everything to get to where we wanted to go without much hassle, but far enough away that we could escape the 'city' while we recharged. A great place, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Basic, but serves its purpose”
Reviews.Author: AndesRuby
Reviews.Content: Typically, when I go to New York, I stay just outside the city, but I was traveling with a friend who wanted to lodge in Manhattan. As one would expect, what you get in Manhattan for one price is of a lower caliber than what you get for the same price elsewhere. I'll be objective: the place is clean, and it's within a block or two of parking options and a subway stop. That's a plus. Upon checkin, they also informed us that they have free Wi-Fi, and those without Wi-Fi capabilities can connect for 10 cents per minute in their lounge area. Additionally, they offer coffee in the mornings. If you want these things, those are also a plus. The Hotel Alexander is in a safe location in a pretty laid-back part of Manhattan. We noticed a lot of bakeries and coffee shops (good for a convenient breakfast), groceries, and Mexican restaurants in the vicinity. It's an unexciting area, but it's nice. The room: there was a dresser, a night table, a vanity (with a mirror), and a closet, which would all be good for a longer stay, if you needed to store things. The room also had a small armchair. The comforter was ripped, but the bedding was clean. There were three big windows (lots of light). If you're freezing at night, pull the blinds back and take a look at the window; they seem to leave the windows cracked, so that might be your problem. On to the bathroom: there is a shared bathroom for every corridor on a given floor. The bathroom has the usual -- sink, shower/tub, toilet, toilet paper, towel rack, wastebasket , window, mirror -- but nothing else. There's no soap dispenser either (Bring your own soap to the bathroom.). Also, you aren't supposed to flush the paper (You dispose of it in the wastebasket by the toilet.). If you've traveled in developing countries, this isn't novel. But I've actually never seen this before in the U.S.. Just be aware that they only seem to clean the bathroom once a day, and the wastebasket in your (shared) bathroom will contain other pepole's dirty toilet paper. If you're alright with this, then that's good. If you've never seen this before, you might be disgusted. Depends on where you've been. My friend was minorly inconvenienced by the fact that she had to ask at the front desk for towels and toilet paper (At one point, the bathroom ran out of it.), and that when she went downstairs for coffee in the morning, they were out of that as well. In a way, the staff seemed slightly unorganized; for instance, not keeping the bathrooms stocked with paper (for one), but also, on the morning we left, there was a pile of laundry on the elevator, just riding up and down the floors by itself. This isn't really a problem, but if you're a luxury traveler, you probably won't like this place. If all you want though is a clean place in a safe location, and you're looking for a cheap accomodation, the Hotel Alexander isn't bad. Just be aware that you could get a bigger, more comfortable room, in a hotel much closer to the more exciting parts of Manhattan, for the same price, by looking somewhere like Jersey City. Would I stay here again? Probably not. But that's just because there are other options to be found in the area which offer a better "bang for your buck." If you don't mind basic accomodations and you don't feel inconvenienced by having to ask for things like towels, then there's absolutely nothing wrong with this hostel.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME value”
Reviews.Author: Anikabella
Reviews.Content: I had never been to New York City and decided to go for a long weekend with my boyfriend. We were on a budget and after looking at the hotels available in NYC, we were completely horrified by the prices of hotels! We really wanted to be in Manhanttan and this hotel delivered to the basic needs we needed. I've looked at many reviews sites online for this hotel and other "cheap" ones and this is the best price/value available. Reservations: I made the reservations online and had absolutely no problem. I got exactly what I had asked for. If you're worried about it, call them and make sure the reservation went thru, but this was unnecessary for us. Overall, It cost me about $220 for two nights! I don't think you can beat that in Manhattan.... Check-In: We arrived in New York City Saturday morning after a 16 hour bus ride. We've checked-in without any problems. We then proceeded to go in the "lounge" to use the bathroom, change our clothes and freshen up. The hotel let us put all of our luggage into a storage closet for free, since our rooms would not be ready until later in the afternoon. Room: Our room was small, but it had what we needed and you need to remember that this is NYC - Everything is small unless you pay the big bucks (over $600.00). There was a bed, a desk, a night table with a lamp, an alarm clock, a head/-to-toe miroir and a TV with cable. They also left towels, face cloths, soap and shampoo at our arrival. We put our room as "DO NOT DISTURB" even when we were not there, so I can't say anything about room cleaning other than what we got when checked-in - a clean room. We were only there for three days, so we really did not need our bedsheets changed... (Trying to do my part for the environment) Bathrooms: There's 4 complete bathrooms on each floors. Very basic (tub with shower, toilet and sink). They are cleaned several times a day. The one near my room was always clean and available. My boyfriend got a busy bathroom once but then just proceeded to walk down the hall to another one. It's NOT a big deal. You could always try another floor if all four of the bathrooms were taken on yours (which I doubt would happen!). I did bring flip-flops to take my shower, but It was clean enough that I really didn't have too. My bf didn't use any. For about $50.00/night extra, you can get a room WITH a bathroom but we thought it was not worth it, since we were spending so little time in our room. Lounge: They have free coffee there, and there's a few tables, chairs and couches. There's also a big screen TV , a few computers and some vending machines. Internet is $1 for 10 minutes. We've used it once to find a specific restaurant we had heard of and it works great. No credit card needed. Staff: Nice. We had to wait around for someone to show up once, but only for a few minutes so cannot complain about that. Elevators: There is an elevator, but it is very slow and VERY small. We took it to bring our luggages up and we could only fit ourselves (average) and two suitcases. Another guy was waiting for the elevator and could not get in!! Without luggage, you can probably squize 4 people in there. We were happy to be on the 4th floor. We used the staircases for the remainder of the trip. Therefor, I do NOT recommand this hotel for someone with disabilities. Location: It is not downtown, but it is very easily accessible and the neighbourhood is nice and quiet. The Subways 1,2,3 is just a block away, there are a few buses too that come every 5 minutes and you're about 11$ + tip away from timesquare in a cab! Also, The nearest subway station is a "main" one, meaning that you can also take express subways and it will stop there! On a regular train, it takes about 15 minutes to timesquare, but on an express, it's 5 minutes! The walk to the subway station is less than 5 minutes. Literrally 2 blocks away. Check-Out: We checked out in the morning but again, left our luggages in the storage locker for the remainder of the day as our bus back was only leaving at night. They didn't charge us anything extra, though their website says they'll charge you $1/bag. Keep in mind that hotel is a 1* hotel in NYC!!! This City is an exception to the general rule of hotel elsewhere - everything is overpriced. Don't expect anything fancy. Hotel Alexander gives you a SAFE and CLEAN place to sleep. That's IT. If you're thinking of actually spending time in your room, GO SOMEWHERE ELSE. We got up at 8 am every morning, were gone until 5pm, came back to change our clothes and then were back out until 1am. Overall, if you're on a budget, can walk up a few floors and just want a clean and safe place to sleep, I very much recommand this hotel.... Otherwise, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid it like the Plague! Fawlty Towers!”
Reviews.Author: NiallFrenchPaddy
Reviews.Content: The reason we booked into this hotel was that it seemed to be according to reviews I'd read, one of the most reasonably priced hotels in Manhattan with satisfactory facilities. We didn't expect anything fancy nor want it since it was just gonna be a place to to rest our heads whilst discovering beautiful NYC. Firstly, having been alerted to the problems some previous reviewers experienced when booking on the website, I decided to make sure they had our booking and phoned them from France where I live. After being told to call back 3 times (the night guy wasn't "able" to confirm) I eventually was told that they didn't have my booking on their computer but not to worry 'cos it would be downloaded soon...this was 5 days after booking! When I insisted I wanted him to check, he hung up the phone! When I called back, he answered and put the phone way from his ear before hanging up several times. Enraged, but especially worried about our booking I sent a mail and eventually they replied giving me a confirmation number...good start! The beginning of our stay went alright; hotel is nicely located in upper west side, near metro. Even the shared bathrooms wasn't a major problem (for me anyhow, more so for my wife), you could always find one on other floors in okish condition. The rooms are old and sparsely decorated but what you expect for that category hotel. So I appreciate why most people evaluate it as good value for money. But you recognise what a hotel is really like when there's a problem: On our third night (we were staying for 4) in the middle of the night our radiator (which hadn't been working until then! leaving the room quite cold..) suddenly started making lots of noise and eventually hissing out steam into the room. After subsiding , it then started again and got worse. I phoned reception straigth away and his contribution was "don't worry it'll stop.." He couldn't change our room cos the hotel was fully booked up After it had got disturbingly worse , and I'd held the phone to the radiator to wake up the useless guy at reception, and forced him to come to the room to witness it, we had to leave our room and go outside. My wife was in tears and I was getting more annoyed with this guy who didn't care less Low and behold we bumped into another couple at reception who had the same problem in their room, and had to leave their room too!! Our room was 411 . Theirs was on the 6th floor I actually tried to alert the fire brigade via the fire alert but the guy at reception kept running up and disabling it. Since I didn't want to spoil my holiday by aggressing him I gave up and ignored him since he was I'd realised by now just useless. Eventually he had no other choice but to turn off the central heating in the hotel, which he didn't want to do beforehand because he "didn't want to get complaints from the guests" (good one that!) and thus we managed to get 2 hours' "relaxation" in our room cos naturally we didn' sleep after what had happened... The next day we managed to change room, no thanks to "our friend" the night guy who hadn't even told the others in the hotel about the problem! To finish this happy story, I eventually managed to corner the manager, who'd been trying to avoid me the morning we were leaving, and I exposed the story to him...he hadn't even heard about it at that stage! His words of wisdom were "that"s unfortunate" I informed him that naturally we expected some discount here, he said "Don't worry, we'll make you happy" I found out when checking out that this consisted of a 50$ discount (about a third of the price for one night!) Anything less than not paying for the night of the incident was an insult by any standards, but at that stage I just laughed to myself I was realising this would be a funny story to tell... So basically if you have a problem on your stay expect the worst customer service ever experienced, and I've been to a lot of places over the world... Our advice: Pay a little more and book a real hotel This one should be shut down Niall (an otherwise happy Irishman living in France)

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Kpjrl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Hotel Alexander for 8 nights last October. We booked the hotel through the hotel website and contact them by e-mail a couple of weeks before arriving just to make sure they have received the reservation and everything was fine. Check in was very smooth and we were given a room on the first floor which was very useful. We brought a laptop with us and it was very cool to have free wi-fi access in the lounge. All day long there was also free coffee in the lounge. We use to buy pastries and fruits on Broadway in the evening and eat them for breakfast next morning. The staff was helpful and friendly. The room itself was beyond our expectation. It was big enough with a queen bed, 2 desks and 2 chairs, a closet and a cabled TV. Obviously, the furnitures and the blanket were not new, but for the price we paid for the room it was fine. We hade maid service every day with fresh sheets and towel and complimentary toiletries (soap and shampoo). Of course, the furnitures were The only thing I have to complain about is that the doors were slaming loudly sometimes in the nights, so if you are a light sleeper I suggest that you bring ear plugs with you! The bathroom was also beyond our expectations. It was cleaned twice a day and honestly I didn't find a single hair in the bath every time I used it. The only thing I didn't like with the bathroom was that there's no soap and towel in the bathroom so it's not very useful for handwashing. The hotel is VERY close to the subway (2 streets east) and to Broadway which was very convenient for all the restaurants, pharmacies and corner stores. The neibourghood made me feel secure and we were also very close to Central Park. In conclusion, for the price we paid for a room in New York it was beyond expectations and perfect for our needs. I recommend Hotel Alexander. And if you want to see all the best in NYC and save money, I suggest that you buy the New York Pass, which we appreciated at 100%!

Reviews.Title: “Shared Bathrooms No Fan”
Reviews.Author: 5fromUtah
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in this hotel to try and save money. After reading the reviews I wondered how bad it could be. Iâ€™ve stayed at much nicer KOAâ€™s. With all the 5 star ratings, I suspect the hotel management is rating their own hotel. The first room we were given on the 7th floor. The one small elevator was usually kept busy by the housekeeping staff or other guests (up to 5 minutes), so it was quicker to use the stairs. When we complained that the bed had lube soaking from the mattress through the thin sheet (no mattress pad) we were promptly given a new room on the first floor. It was nice to not have to climb the stairs or wait for the elevator. Other than the having very thin sheet between you and a nasty mattress from 1973, the rooms were sparse but ok. The bathrooms only had a small window for ventilation so the bathroom and hallway usually smelled like someoneâ€™s bowl movement. The view of a yucky pair of red bloomers and latex glove hanging on a wire outside the bathroom window was a nice touch. Donâ€™t forget to bring soap and a towel with you every time you go to the bathroom. Also, it is hard to find a dry place to put your things while you shower, let alone find a dry spot to step. Think of it as a game. If there is absolutely no where else to stay, this is your place. Otherwise I would spend the extra 50 dollars and stay somewhere else. It seems like the hotel is kept busy enough so Iâ€™m sure the owners donâ€™t feel any need for changes like: New Mattresses New Sheets Mattress Pads Fans in the bathrooms Soap and Paper towel dispenser/air drier in the bathroom Rubber Mat in the bathroom to help isolate you from the puddle

Reviews.Title: “Reservations don't mean anything!”
Reviews.Author: azroth
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I booked a room a month in advance for a week long stay. When we tried to check in we were told that our reservation was canceled. The funny thing was that we had not canceled nor had we been contacted saying that our reservation was canceled. He stated we should of received an e-mail letting us know when we had not (i later overheard him on the phone asking someone why they didn't send out the cancellations) We had just flown all the way from Seattle and he offered no assistance or even an apology. The man at the front desk was extremely rude and unhelpful just stating that there was rain damage and he had no rooms. I asked him if he could help us find another place to stay and he just said "i don't have any other hotels". He showed me a list guests that have not arrived who's rooms were apparently OK and said "if your name isn't on this list, i don't have your reservation". I asked to speak to his manager or the hotel owner, he told me that he did not have his contact information. After explaining to him that he has to have his contact information in case of emergency he said "OK, I have it but I'm not going to give it to you". We were left stranded without a place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: snoochie1981
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed at the Hotel Alexander in New York for 5 nights and we had a great time. As pointed out in other reviews, the hotel is really a cross between a hostel and a hotel but is good value. The local neighbourhood is great with cafes, diners, delis, convenience stores and restaurants. It's also walking distance to Central Park and one block from the 94 St entrance for the 1,2 and 3 trains on the subway. The hotel itself is good and the room is generally very clean (new sheets and towels everyday) but the only problem (and quite a big problem at that) is that the bed had bed bugs and my girlfriend has come back to England with bites all over her (her doctor has confirmed that they are bed bugs). This put a real downer on the stay at the hotel. We will definitely take other reviews more seriously (as we did see several other reviews mentioning bed bugs and room cleanliness) in future.

Reviews.Title: “Great Budget Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RedsetterLondon
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during our first visit to New York - it was the cheapest hotel that I could find at short notice in Manhattan and I would definitely stay here again. The bathrooms are shared but are cleaned regularly - ours was right across the hall and it didn't feel like it was shared as there was only one occasion that I had to wait to use it. The room was basic but again - clean and comfortable with a TV, dressing table, bedside cabinet and closet - everything you need and no more. There is a lounge area with access to the internet which costs a dollar for 10 minutes - a handy facility for those who don't know what they're doing! The location is great - very close to bus and subway routes and a short walk to central park. The staff are friendly and welcoming and I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that's on a budget but still likes a bit of comfort!

Reviews.Title: “Alexander, there are better than this”
Reviews.Author: kat2cute
Reviews.Content: This hotel is priced slightly lower than most other Manhattan hotels for a reason. The rooms themselves are nice enough, but the shared bath is a pain in the butt. There is only 1 bathroom per hall, so you end up wandering the halls looking for an open toilet/shower. There is no complimentary breakfast, and they even charged extra to hold our bags for a couple hours after checkout! The Comfort Inn in the theater district was a better price, free checked bags and complimentary breakfast, with just as nice of a room and your own bathroom. I am sure there are also several other better hotels than the Alexander in Manhattan which are in the same price range.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place w/ reasonable price on Manhattan”
Reviews.Author: Vilczaq-s
Reviews.Content: Positives: 1. 4-minutes walking distance to 1,2,3 metro lines on Manhattan 2. 10 Minutes to Central Park 3. Clean and spacious room with queen bed (we took) 4. Spacious walk-in closed in the room 5. Very friendly and helpful staff 6. Cool lounge area with free wi-fi internet (bring your laptop with you) 7:00-22:00 7. Coca-cola/water/Juice automat with reasonable prices (better than in nearby shops) 8. Free coffee in the morning (afternoon on request) 9. Hot water in the lounge (really helpful if you have your own coffee, tea or instant soup). 10. Baggage storage (extra 2$ per piece). Negatives: 1. Cab (Taxi) flat rate Hotel - JFK is 60$+toll 5$+Tip (Typical yellow cab-yellow taxi rate to JFK from Manhattan is 45$) 2. No refrigerator or microwave at room (we took) Overall: One of the best places we found during our 3 weeks trip to USA

Reviews.Title: “Comfy & Cosy”
Reviews.Author: dlh107
Reviews.Content: I must admit , when booking this Hotel. I was a little nervous. It was my first time "sharing a bathroom" I was impressed. The bathroom was very clean. The longest I had to wait was 10 minutes. And that was in the morning. Rush hour , 8amish...At night , it was quiet...The lounge was filled with laptop bandits. I think for the price in New York. This was quaint. I would recommend this hotel and will visit it if I ever need to stay in the city! Bargain price! I really like that it was off the beaten path and you we're only 2 blocks away from mayhen. A cab downtown was only 10 - 12 bucks!!

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC!”
Reviews.Content: My bestfriend and I decided to visit New York for the first time. We were on a tight budget for a hotel, and after days of searching for something cheap and atleast decent we booked with Hotel Alexander. We didn't know what to expect, this was my first time ever being in a hotel. My expectations were met, as I was expecting something dingy and stinky. We were greeted upon arrival, check-in was very smooth, check out was easy and fast. We had a room with one double bed, as we only thought we were going to be sleeping there. The room itself was small but served its purpose. It was cleaned everyday (new towels, new sheets, and a vacum). The bathroom was very clean, and was cleaned twice aday. Although it would be a fight for it sometimes. The staff were very friendly. Although I didnt spend much time in the lounge, people seemed pleased with it. It had computers in which offered internet which was a plus. The only thing we had to request was a hairdryer. Upon checking out which was 12PM our bus didn't leave till 8:00pm, they offered to store our luggage at no fee. All in all this hotel was amazing, it served its purpose. Your def, not paying for 5 star so dont expect it. Book it as soon as you can it's worth it, and most of the times they have excellent deals room rates and seasonal booking. I am booking again for another week in december.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Value for Money!”
Reviews.Author: The_Owl123
Reviews.Content: After reading many of the reviews on here and other websites I decided to go with this hotel after much consideration. We were on a very tight budget of no more then 35pound a night each and this hotel met our needs. Before going I was a little apprehensive to what it would be like reading some of the negative reviews, however, on arrival I was shocked at just how nice it was. What great value for money, on arrival the staff were VERY friendly and helpful, contrary to what other people had written. It was very welcoming. I booked a double (as it was cheaper) and they put us in a twin, which would have cost more if intially done at the booking procedure. Once at the room was nicely shocked, room was a good size, TV, clean towels(and plenty of them). Bathrooms were always fairly clean apart from late at night when they had had the most use. Get cleaned every morning and would be a little grubby by 8pm but nothing major, defintely not enough to put someone off staying there. Longest i had to wait for a shower in 4 nights was 5mins not a problem at all only having two per floor. if a problem just go up a floor or down and try there. Staff throughtout were friendly and helpful, during our stay there tropical storm hit us so decided to stay in, allowed us to use phone and offered us takeaway menus so all made very easy. Communal area was nice and clean with internet access. Location was good. Its two blocks down from nearest subway station (96street) which was really handy. Would adivse getting a metro card for $25 for a week, so easy and convienant. On Broadway there is plenty of places to eat. I would defintely stay again! Great value for money! Location superb. Close walk to central park, which is amazing! Staff friendly and hotel clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Trendy and original”
Reviews.Author: sk_denny
Reviews.Content: This is a very unique hotel that is not part of the chain. It is trendy and modern. I'm no interior designer but I could tell they had some serious and expensive work done. The lobby was small but very artistic. Interesting sofa, table, lamps, wall... like from catalogue. They made good use of that little space. Elevators are clean and fast. Room was small like all the rooms in Manhattan but it was very cozy and practical. It had great bed, high quality sheets and comforter, new TV, warm colors and lot of light. We actually ended up staying in - it was so nice. Service was exceptional. We got the wake up call, directions, recommendations for restaurant, etc. Hotel had lively bar which we used for little bit. Location was the best about this hotel. Even though it was little bit difficult to find it due to not very visible entrance), we came to appreciate how close to everything hotel was. We could walk everywhere including Times Square. Definitely stay here! You will get the outside of box experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good quality/moderate price”
Reviews.Author: morue14
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very cleaned.My girlfriend and I was in a bedroom with a double bed and TV.Size of the room is small but enough to have a good night and journey.Furniture provide enough space to store clothes and so on.Towels are included. Shared bathroom are nice and cleaned, at least, twice a days but shower and restroom are in the same room :(( The staff were professional and polite although not friendly. 3 computers provide internet access, in the sitting rooom. flat TV screen and newspaper are also available.No breakfast but possibility to have it close to the hotel (Broadway av) face to the metro station (also a good point to be closed to the metro). Pleasant and very quiet neighbourhood.

Reviews.Title: “a great experience...book it!”
Reviews.Author: AngloPole
Reviews.Content: Excellent customer service, cleanliness and location. The Alexander represented great value for money...we'll definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Infested by BedBugs”
Reviews.Author: xpiddu
Reviews.Content: HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE! I had my body hitching after the first night I slept at the Alexander. And the second and last night I was so nervous knowing that the room was full of bedbugs that I could not even sleep. This place should not be called hotel and not even a hostel. It is by and large the dirtiest place I have ever slept (and I have seen many things, travelling extensively in Europe, Latin America and Asia). What is really irritating is that this place is the kind of place that manages to sell out all its rooms because travelers looking at the website are unaware of the real conditions of the hotel! Rooms are small, creepy and dirty (definitely not what you see on the website pictures!). Shared bathroom are so stinky that you only wish to get out of them in a fraction of second. I chose this place because it was the cheapest double room in Manhattan but I would NEVER DO IT AGAIN! And on top of that they charge you almost 200USD? I really felt I was a victim of a rip-off and had no defense!

Reviews.Title: “Clean and cheap!”
Reviews.Author: PicoVancouver
Reviews.Content: This is the place to book if you want to see the sights of New York and have a clean & quiet place to rest your head! It was extremely affordable, coffee in the morning, very close to the subway and to Central Park, and although it was a small room, it was clean, fresh towels & soaps, and *air conditioned*. Yes, the bathrooms were shared (two per floor; ten rooms per floor), but this was not an issue for us... if the one closest to you was in use, just go down a floor! If you want five star service and lavender-scented sheets, then book a $400 per night hotel elsewhere. This was great value ($120 per night in July!) and the basics were all there.

Reviews.Title: “Great for the price”
Reviews.Author: boatwithoutoars
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at worse hotels than this for more money in NY. For the fairly easygoing traveller, well-aware of the somewhat gross conditions of a shared bathroom, this is an ideal place. Cheap, safe, and really close to the 1 train at 96th. The front desk was nice, but I would not recommend hailing a airport cab through them, as prices are higher than standard yellow cabs or taking the train to the airport. Hey, there's even a television in the room. If you have the money to stay at a fancier place, then stay at a fancier place. It's rocket science, I know. For the budget traveller, there is nothing to be afraid of here other than some mysterious hairs in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Fair”
Reviews.Author: livcl
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel searching a lot before my trip and it was exactly what I was looking for: good location, good price and a clean place to sleep. Only 2 blocks from the metro station, good and a lot of options of restaurants around. I spent 3 nights there with my boyfriend, it was our first time in NYC and we were out most of the time so it was a good place to rest and to take a shower after walking in the city the whole day. We didn't have problems with the shared bathroom cause it was always clean and empty when we needed to use it. Of course it is not the most beautiful hotel in the world but for the price that you pay I guess it is one of the best options in NYC besides it is way better than hostels.

Reviews.Title: “A good find”
Reviews.Author: glorheath
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one mid-week night in a room on the first floor. Neighborhood was safe, subway easily accessible, and hotel was easy to find. Most front desk workers were more than helpful. Room was clean and small with ample storage space, including hangers in the closet. Bathroom was very clean. When showering water did tend to pool on the floor even with shower curtain tightly closed, but the bathmat (provided) solved that! The only problem I had was with the reservation. I found this hotel on Hotels.com, but decided to book directly with the hotel on their own website. I booked the room 3 weeks in advance and called to confirm the night before only to be told that they had no reservation for me. Luckily there were still a few rooms available, but for $50 more for the night. I spoke to the front desk worker, the manager, and the general mananger. They were all very pleasant and willing to listen to my situation. Unfortunately, they were not willing to reduce the rate to the rate I reserved 3 weeks before. My advice is to reserve a room by CALLING them or by using a third-party website. Their website reservation system was not reliable for my reservation.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap but Not Good”
Reviews.Author: vivdiesel
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel because it was the best price in Manhattan ... for that, it was good ... the rest, not so good. Room - the rooms are small and in great need of updating. The beds were uncomfortable and not quite big enough for two adults. Service - the service was very poor. We stayed four in a room and they only gave us two towels. I asked for more, but none were available. Bathrooms - I imagined a bathroom shared between two rooms, which I would have been fine with, but there are only two bathrooms on the entire floor. It was pretty tough to get in for a shower or to use the toilet. Pay the extra amount and find another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “not a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: naia_14
Reviews.Content: Review on Hotel Alexander I wish I had looked up review before booking this hotel. Their website makes it look so great, and doesn't really explain things to you. The rooms were clean, but were just a step up from a hostel. The hallways always smelled, sometimes so much that I couldn't stand out in them for more than seconds. The elevator there is only fit for 3, and I really mean 3 regular sized people. I, being somewhat claustrophobic, decided to forgo it all together for my weekend stay, and used the elevator, though my room was on the fourth floor. Good exercise after all that food and drinks I had that weekend. They say there's a lounge, but itâ€™s more like a room with some chairs, internet (you pay for it, don't know how much), and the coffee was horrible, there wasn't any cream or milk, but I know I was asking too much, right? I don't know what was worse, the bathroom or the service. The bathrooms were shared bathroom, which they mention on the website, but I assumed it meant sharing with one or two other rooms, not the whole hallway. It was very small, with at tub (don't know why they just didn't make it a shower; no one should let their bodies touch that thing). The shower curtain was so disgusting, like it's been there for years. The toilet, when clean is usable (if your lucky to be the first one to use it right after the maids clean it), but most of the time isn't. The floor gets extremely wet after any one shower, even if you take the quickest shower ever. ****Bring flip-flops to shower in. If you forget, you can buy cheap ones on Broadway, two streets away from the "hotelâ€�. Also bring your own towels too. Might as well bring soap, shampoo, conditioner, and toothpaste. They provide the first three, but they are the worst quality. **** The service there was really bad. I realized this first at check in, when the guy checking us in seemed full of attitude; then when my friend asked for a iron, and the same guy gave her more attitude, warning her that she had to bring it back (you could buy a better iron at Wal-Mart for 10 bucks, lol); third incident was when my other friend asked for a band aid, and they only gave her one, saying that if she needed more, there was a pharmacy down the street. The only positive things about the hotel were: They let us check in late (12-1am); the location was close to a lot of things (restaurants, stores); the neighborhood was safe; they didn't complain about us making noise, or returning to the hotel at 5am; we found free parking on the street (we got lucky our first night, the second night we got a $125 ticket when we parked two streets away). It was the cheapest place we could find for that weekend, seeing how it is summer and there was a big event in NYC that weekend, but for $400+ for two nights, do you blame me for expecting just a little bit more of the place? Be warned, spend a little extra, probably $15-$50 more dollars, and you can stay at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations...”
Reviews.Author: mcdrye
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay in this hotel. After reading some reviews I was quite worried about the state of the room etc but was pleasantly surprised! To save money we got the LIRR to Penn (CityTicket $3.25!) then subway to 96th Street. Exit from SW stairwell '94th Street' and turn left and walk 1 and a half blocks. Couldn't believe how close the hotel was! Neighbourhood was lively even at midnight and I felt completely safe. When we first arrived the hotel receptionist was real friendly, got up to our room (2 Double beds, Room 207) which was quite big! Had a closet and a separate room where a private bathroom used to be! No mouse traps, nothing wrong altogether. View was of the opposite building but this also meant no noise from the street. Plenty of towels (3 each). Only gripe was the shared bathroom was in constant use by a family on our floor, though there were 2 others on the same floor. The bathroom was generally tidy, maybe the shower curtain should be changed. Hotel common room is clean and has cheap internet access ($1 for 10 minutes!). Great for checking in online and printing boarding pass or uploading photos. Check-out was at 12pm, our flight wasn't until 22:30 so we used the storage room which was securely locked.

Reviews.Title: “Not an hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: jeff41
Reviews.Content: I don't know where the other guest that gave review have been but this place is not an hotel in my view. These are some example: - mouse trap under the bed !!! - no closet!!! - small room : bed against two wall and 2' to move - bathroom door on the hallway with a very light lock! - mini window opening in front of a wall - like the movies! And I don't agree about the prices. The following nights I got a real 3 star hotel room for the same price. Bottom line: stay away from Alexander for more than $50 per night!

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: drobinson4
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Hotel Alexander with my family this past weekend. We had a wonderful experience in New York City, but a terrible experience at this hotel. First of all, the hotel should not be advertised as a hotel, as it is actually a hostel. We were mislead by their advertising through expedia.com. There was only one bathroom to share between 6-10 other rooms on the floor. Second, we were treated very poorly by the staff. We had requested a cot the first night, upon which we were told to wait until the following day to request a cot because the maids were gone for the night at 6pm when we arrived. The next day, we asked another person at the front desk if we could request a cot for the night and he said, "Well, we don't have any cots, so what do you think about that?!" We didn't even know how to respond! We didn't understand why it was neccessary to treat us so rudely, when we asked a simple question, and, when we were told the day before it would not be an issue. Finally, it was a hastle to shower in this hotel. We were never provided with the same amount of towels and had to hunt the maids down (only in the morning when they were available) to get the number of towels that we needed. And when we asked the front desk for help, they were extremely rude to us again! We strongly feel that we did not deserve this kind of treatment and it did take away from our experience in New York City. We feel compelled to do something so that the next person is not mislead or treated this way. The staff and management at Hotel Alexander should know that is it not acceptable to treat people who are paying $200+/night to stay at their facility and it will not be tolerated. I will never recommend this hotel to anyone traveling to NYC.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, clean and cheap hotel”
Reviews.Author: thprae
Reviews.Content: Before I was going to NYC I, as many other have done, tried to find a hotel were I got the most quality for the lowest amount of money. I honestly believe that Hotel Alexander lives up to this selection criteria. When you stay there you get a clean room (the room is cleaned every day) and access to bathing and toilet facilities which also always appear clean. Moreover the hotel is situated in a quiet and safe area where I always felt comfortable. The overall service is good and friendly, but you should not expect five star treatment. But then again you get what you pay for and what you pay is somewhat cheap compared to other hotels in Manhattan. At the time we looked into booking this was in fact the cheapest I could find (not including hostels) and trust me I searched a lot. When trying to book a room you should always see what the price is on their homepage and compare it with hotel booking sites. We saved around 20% when booking at their homepage! An other advantage is that there is a subway very close by as well is eating (you have to try breakfast at the Key West Diner on Broadway between 94th and 95th) and shopping possibilities (all of Broadway is in fact filled with shops, delis and cafes). Overall I can recommend this for persons who are looking for a good and clean place to stay in NYC where you use the hotel as your base for exploring the city. SoHo is about 30 min away and Times square and Grand Central station is only a 10 and 15 min ride away by subway respectively.

Reviews.Title: “Totally Adequate”
Reviews.Author: rswanOttawa
Reviews.Content: Clean, comfortable, quiet. No problems with bookings.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for a Budget traveller”
Reviews.Author: liliania
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 4 nights. Hotel was clean and nice. We had a shared bedroom and it was most of the time spotlessly clean. All I have to complain is that the room doors and walls are quite thin, so you hear almost everything. If itÂ´s cold weather youÂ´d better know that there was only linen on bed not blancket.

Reviews.Title: “clean small friendly convenient cheap”
Reviews.Author: Baxter008
Reviews.Content: My family and friends booked two rooms during our April school break for ourselves and our young children. We went to the hotel's website and got a great deal. Our interactions with staff were very good, and we found everyone to be very helpful. The rooms and shared baths were very clean, the lobby was pleasant and the coffee was fresh. The hotel was very quiet, and we appreciate the non-smoking policy. Minor drawbacks--elevator was slow, staff had little information about good restaurants and nearby places of interest. The idea of shared baths isn't a plus, but they were absolutely spotless, and never a line. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Cute Hotel on Upper West Side!”
Reviews.Author: kristydances
Reviews.Content: The hotel is on a quaint street on the Upper West Side of Manhattan. I was having a girlfriend's weekend and felt completely safe staying at the hotel--just us girls. The subway was close and the area restaurants were above average and decently priced. We stayed in a room with a double bed and a bathroom. It was tiny, but very very clean! I wouldn't recommend this hotel to anyone with claustrophobia, but I didn't mind one bit! The hotel staff was friendly and helpful, and the rooms were spotless. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Capt_Haddock_99
Reviews.Content: PROS: relatively inexpensive, decent location close to subway, clean CONS: shared bathrooms Spent a lot of time looking for affordable hotels in New York before settling on this place, mainly for the location. The hotel is just 1.5 blocks away from the 96th St subway station, which runs to all the major tourist sights. The hotel is in a residential area, but there are some decent restaurants and breakfast places in the area. The hotel seems like it's been recently renovated, but received spartan furnishings in the process. The room is small and the bed is adequate. There's a small TV and a telephone, a desk and a chair and that's it. Everything was clean, including, surprisingly, the shared bathrooms. I didn't have to wait at all to use the bathrooms, as there are three per floor. The radiator plumbing in the room was quite loud, however, I heard loud clicking throughout the night but got used to it. Staff was efficient and helpful. I had none of the problems that other reviewers experienced. Would stay here again if on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “A fancy hostel”
Reviews.Author: cccgraham
Reviews.Content: We spent a weekend at Hotel Alexander and had a room with a private bath and a double bed. The price was really cheap for NY City, but that's because there are no frills. I read tripadvisor before we booked our stay and I didn't see the following complaints-- there was no mattress cover/pad on the bed; there was no blanket on the bed (the high temp when we were there was 45 degrees); the room was very small (maybe 8' x 12'); and there was no closet in our room, which meant we had to hang our garment bag on the shower rod in the bathroom. Many of the tripadvisor reviews I had read were very accurate-- there was a phone in our hallway that rang for no apparent purpose and there was a door to our hallway that slammed shut every time someone came through (in the 8 a.m. to 9 a.m. hours, the door was slamming shut every 5 minutes). Also, we ran out of hot water both mornings that we showered (I showered once in teh afternoon and there was plenty of hot water). Also, I tried calling the hotel several times before we came to inquire about nearby parking. Half of the time the phone would ring endlessly w/out being answered. The other times, I was informed to "just drive around" to find a nearby parking. I was also told that there was a parking garage across the street (which was closed when we checked in, causing us to drive around to find another one). Basically this hotel was like a fancy hostel. Our room was very cheap and clean, so if you're looking not to spend a lot and aren't expecting a lot, this place will be perfect. I know next time I go to the City, I will pay a little more to stay in a nicer hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A good cheap find!”
Reviews.Author: bodge75
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I stayed here for 4 nights and don't have any real complaints. The price was great (at least half the cost of other places we looked at) and the location is brilliant as you're about a 5 minute walk from the nearest metro station (West 96th St) which can get you into the center of town in about 5 minutes and only 10 or so to get to far downtown. The hotel is a bit dated but the rooms were clean and a good size and the maids came in every day with fresh towels. The shared bathroom was never a real problem; as others have said if they are busy pop down to the next floor. We found the staff to be very friendly too with good advice if needed. There's a great diner (Key West Diner) on Broadway only 5 minutes away which is great for breakfast and a true New York experience. Overall we would recommend this hotel and if your on a budget it is perfect and judging from some reviews of the more expensive hotels you won't get value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, especially for the price!”
Reviews.Author: jexxicasaurus
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights on my most recent trip. Totally loved the place. Staff was incredibly nice, room was much bigger than I had expected. Shared bathrooms were no inconvenience and kept very clean, very little trouble with them being occupied when I needed it. One downside is no sink in the rooms so I couldn't brush my teeth or anything in there but that wasn't a really big deal. Location was also very great, just blocks from the subway as well as a pharmacy and some great places to eat! I definitely plan to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible stay”
Reviews.Author: Victims
Reviews.Content: It is the Most terrible hotel i have ever seen in my life ..we booked for two nights..the first night, we found mouse in the room so we called the front disk and he offered to change the room so we went to the fourth floor..and you can not imagine how bad was it??? it smells soooooooooooooooooooooo bad and all the bath rooms in the floor were so dirty and the heater in the room doesnt work, so we called the man again ..and he was so rude with us, he said we dont have other rooms what can i do for you??in a way he wants to starts the fight so i had to calm my husband down in the morring we moved to 6th floor in a third room it was so small and was so freezing ..i was shivering all the night and when we called them again he said he will go to the basement and he heard some noise in the pipes and that is ...we had to wear all the clothes to feel warm and we left in the early morning and we are planning to dont leave our rights and warn all the people from this bad experience ..it is unfair to pay that amount of money and do fights and get cold or infections from the mouse ..CAn you imagine this story in 2008 in NY

Reviews.Title: “Decent value for money”
Reviews.Author: spock84
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for a week with my girlfriend. Our room was larger than expected and everything was generally very clean, even the shared bathrooms, of which there were three on our floor. I rarely had to wait to use them, but I suppose February is low season, so there might be more people staying there during typical vacationing seasons. The hotel is close to the subway. There's an entrance at Broadway and 94th to the 96th st. station where the 1, 2 and 3 trains all stop. Central Park is also less than 1 km away on foot. The internet access in the room is decent, but you need a cable; there's no wireless network. You need to pay $10 in advance at the front desk (for each day until noon the next day) and if you don't have a cable already they'll provide you with one. The rooms also have TV's with a decent selection of channels, but seriously, you don't go to NYC to watch TV. The staff is mostly very friendly and helpful. Nothing big to complain about there. They all appear to be 1st generation immigrants, Arabs, Indians etc, and sometimes act accordingly. But mostly they're very service minded, great guys that do their stuff by the book (whatever book that may be). A few points of advice: - Bring a few towels of your own, as sometimes you might only get small towels. - Don't get the guy at the front desk to get you a taxi to the airport or elsewhere as you will most likely NOT get an authorized taxi, but a rather expensive buddy of his that WILL try to scam you. He drove us through Harlem on the way to JFK, which I honestly didn't like, although it's probably a lot safer than it used to be, and might be the quickest route for all I know. - The hotel does not have a safe, but they do have a pretty safe storage room for your luggage. I wouldn't leave anything valuable there, though, unless it's in a firmly locked suitcase. - I've seen some people complain about the elevator being slow. I honestly don't think it is. If they're referring to the doors closing slowly, there's a button to close them instantly. All in all, this is a very good budget hotel if you don't mind a few inconveniences. Recommended for solo travelers or young (or young minded) couples, friends.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Place, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: MS08
Reviews.Content: My friend and I recently stayed at the Hotel Alexander on the Upper West Side. I was a little sceptical about its location at first, but it is so close the the subway (2 blocks) and the train takes you straight to Times Square. The staff were wonderful, always smiling and willing to help. We had a minor problem with our first room, but the staff immediately moved us to another. The shared bathrooms were very clean and always free. There are 2 bathrooms on each floor, so we always had access to one if the other was occupied. Lovely lounge area with free tea and coffee. Very cosy and I would definitely recommend to others. Book directly on the hotel website to get the best deal, and you save money on multiple night stays. The only downside is that you can't book extra nights at the hotel through reception, it all needs to be done online which was the only thing we found vaguely annoying.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Value”
Reviews.Author: lanimoo73
Reviews.Content: My friend and I were looking for a decent place to stay at an affordable price and we were very happy to find the Hotel Alexander. We opted for a room with a private bathroom and 2 beds. The room was clean and spartan, but we were hardly there so it was perfect for our needs. The minor problems we encountered were the placement of one of the beds blocking the door, the sporadic towel service in the bathroom and the heat in the room. We solved the bed issue by moving it over when we entered the room. The towels started out fine, but each day they left different variations of sets with either the bath mat or hand towels missing. Finally, one night it was very cold but the boiler wasn't on yet, so we couldn't use the radiator in our room. They turned it on for the next night, so it was much better. Make sure to bring your own toiletries as the soaps and shampoos weren't enough for two people. Even with these minor issues, overall it was a clean place to sleep and the staff was very nice. it did the trick for what we needed and the neighborhood was nice. There were a host of shops just a block or two up the street including a Duane Reade and Starbucks. A Metro stop is close by, so it was very convenient to get most anywhere. There was also a laundromat up 3 blocks, which was nice for my long trip laundry needs. Being away from the madness of Midtown was nice and I felt more like I was living in NYC instead of visiting. It was nice!

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly good”
Reviews.Author: Mom-and-Teen
Reviews.Content: I was desperate for a cheap but safe and clean place to stay for four days over parents' weekend (mid-October is a bad time to book late because every college and university in Manhattan has parents' weekend scheduled at exactly the same time and everywhere is packed.) I was not sure about this hotel, not wanting to share a bath. But when I arrived, what do you know, I had a private bath! Everything was VERY VERY clean -- plain, but clean, and that's what I needed. The neighborhood is fine, only two long blocks from a neighborhood-y part of Broadway with little restaurants and Walgreens and corner markets and the 1/2/3 subway line. I felt fine walking around in the evening. The staff is extremely nice: I spoke with many of them and they were unfailingly kind and helpful and upbeat. They speak many languages, giving the place a very cosmopolitan flair. Funny thing happened: somehow a small mouse got into my room, but I have no idea how it got in -- open window in the bath? Still don't know. Having lived in NYC before, it didn't surprise me, because what counts is how CLEAN the hotel is, and this is a VERY clean place -- no bugs, no dust bunnies. The staff was pretty alarmed about the mouse report, and the handyman was up there in 2 minutes flat to place a trap. He was very put out with the mouse. This whole reaction told me they really aren't used to getting furry creatures in house. I left for home the next day, never did know what happened. I had trouble connecting with the DSL ($5 a day, I think), don't know why (my computer is temperamental), but when desperate, I connected through dial up and it worked fine, but you get charged by the minute. There is a lounge downstairs with a large TV, but I didn't see many people there. There are snack machines that will get you through the night. I'd stay there again, but can't speak to the shared baths, since I got a private one (without knowing I would.)

Reviews.Title: “good value, very nice stay, friendly stuff, good location”
Reviews.Author: russianevy
Reviews.Content: I stayed there with my boyfriend and another friend in a twin room. The room was nice, with 2 windows, heating, television, closet to walk in, everything was clean, and we even had a large sized mirror. bathroom was next door, 2 on the floor (apparently 3, in the aisle on the other site of the elevator) and it was never really a problem getting the bathroom. sometimes u would have to wait for 5 minutes but really this was NOT A PROBLEM AT all. Staff cleaned bathrooms frequently. just 2 minutes to the metro, direct metro connection to timessquare and all the main spots in the centre, the only thing the elevator was quite slow, but it was always a challange to see who is quicker elevator or walking and if u dont mind walking its not a problem. Beds were comfortable maybe blankets a little thin so in winther a little cold, but i am usually frozen so this might not really mean a lot. Tv programms were ok, remote control, snacks in the lobby to get for little money, and coffee for free in the tv common room. in the near area many foodplaces and restuarants for very good prices! go to broadway and turn right, some meters and there is a big take a way place, with pizza, cake, salat, paninis, sandwiches and so on!!! nice staff there too and so close! Very nice hotel with very nice staff and i will definitely stay there again next time i come to new york.

Reviews.Title: “what a bargain in NYC!”
Reviews.Author: Cretey
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the reviews I was a little concerned but since we were after a hotel for less than $100 a night, we couldn't be picky. Surprisingly the hotel was great - front desk staff were super friendly, the room was clean, the shared bathroom was clean...couldn't complain! we didn't hear any rats in the walls as one of the reviews mentioned. Coffee is available free of charge downstairs and they have several computers ($1 for 10 mins) to use. I would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel if you are a student or really keen to save!”
Reviews.Author: EsteeLauder
Reviews.Content: I was a bit reluctant to stay in this hotel, as it wouldn't normally be my first choice. Because I was staying in Manhattan in the highest peak of December, when any hotel would charge a fortune, I decided to go for the cheapest option. The initial impression wasn't really the best, as it reminded me of the premises of the college I went, when I was a student. However, the room was really quiet and clean. The shared bathroom was a bit inconvenient, but I knew that in advance, so no surprises! I wouldn't spend more than two nights there as it's not the type of place that makes you willing to stay longer but it serves its purpose and in comparison to others hotels in NY, it is good value. There is a typical American diner just up the road on Broadway (called Key West Diner & Cafe) where they serve delicious pancakes and offer great service. In my opinion these little amenities near the hotel really complemented my stay. The final verdict is that I would recommend Alexander Hotel mainly to students, but if you are really keen to save your money and don't mind the shared bathroom, go for it (but don't expect much!).

Reviews.Title: “Good all-round affordable accommodation”
Reviews.Author: parityerror
Reviews.Content: Rooms: Small room, however as I was only planning on sleeping in the room (out and about during the day and evenings), this was adequate. Room was cleaned daily, very happy with cleanliness. There is a wardrobe and closet. Shared Bathroom: This wasn't a problem for me. If they were busy I could use one on another floor. two bathrooms per floor, reasonably good ratio General hotel: Not noisy. Internet downstairs in lobby, $1 for ten minutes. Reception was very helpful. Bags can be left in locked room at reception if arriving before checking in or leaving after check-out time. Hotel staff can book taxi to airport, etc. There aren't any facilities, such as "room service", meals, etc, but hey, its New York, you don't need to be at the hotel except to sleep. Elevator is slow, but most of the time there wasn't much demand for it. Location: Subway station was 2 blocks away, about 3 minutes walk. The express subway then took me straight to times square and other good tourist locations. About 30 minutes to get from La Guardia to the hotel, then about 75 minutes (in rush hour) to get to JFK. Hotel can advise of best travelling times. There didn't appear to be anywhere nearby to park a car, I would suggest taking public transport or taxi. Safety: I felt very safe and secure in the hotel. The area of New York was reasonably safe, day and night, however I am a 23 year old male. There were some far worse areas of NY than this area. I wasn't approached by strangers at all. I didn't see any "dodgy people" nearby either. Nearby food: There was a great diner on 7th Avenue and (I think) 96th St which did breakfast. Fantastic food. Otherwise, everything you need is further down-town (ie south) on the subway, towards times square, etc.

Reviews.Title: “If the bathrooms are busy go to another floor!”
Reviews.Author: Dancing_Girl_01
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a two double bed room with a shared bathroom. While it was not huge, it had two closets and two chairs to put luggage on. Our room also has a large mirror mirror and desk. In short it pretty much looked exactly like the pictures on their website. The rooms were very clean as well as the bathrooms. We never had a problem getting into a bathroom as if the ones on our floor were full we would just hop down to the next floor until we found one that was free. It just required a little more legwork. The location was very good. It is only a block and a half from the 1/2/3 lines subway station, and a few blocks from central park. The neighborhood was quiet and we felt safe at all times. For New York standards it is reasonalbly priced and I would stay there again if I ever go back to New York.

Reviews.Title: “Just to spend the night (nothing more!)”
Reviews.Author: Tripopinions
Reviews.Content: We stayed there on Nov. 2007 (room 115) The first room assigned to us was not even clean yet!,,, we got re assigned to another room,,, on this second one the heater was broken and open to max, you can imagine,,, the room was a complete oven! But furtunatly for us some one from the front desk could turn it off, rooms very basically fixed, bathrooms ok but take your own towels and a pair of sandals,,, the good thing is, two blocks from there is the subway station and it takes you directly to anywhere! I don't know about other rooms but the bed we got was (honestly) terrible,,, smelly bed and kind of tilted, if your are rough styled you will not mind staying here.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel Alexander
HotelInfo.Address: 306 W 94th St, New York City, NY 10025
